functionSummary: Protein involved in starvation response, cell wall organization, inositol lipid-mediated signaling, authophagy; localizes to phagophore assembly site

briefDescription: EH domain-containing protein involved in endocytosis
description: EH domain-containing protein involved in endocytosis; actin cytoskeletal organization and cell wall morphogenesis; forms a complex with Sla1p and Pan1p

briefDescription: eIF3a subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3)
description: eIF3a subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3); subunit of the core complex of eIF3; essential for translation; part of a Prt1p-Rpg1p-Nip1p subcomplex that stimulates binding of mRNA and tRNA(i)Met to ribosomes; involved in translation reinitiation; eIF3 is also involved in programmed stop codon readthrough

briefDescription: eIF3b subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3)
description: eIF3b subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3); subunit of the core complex of eIF3; essential for translation; part of a subcomplex (Prt1p-Rpg1p-Nip1p) that stimulates binding of mRNA and tRNA(i)Met to ribosomes; eIF3 is also involved in programmed stop codon readthrough

briefDescription: eIF3c subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3)
description: eIF3c subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3); involved in the assembly of preinitiation complex and start codon selection; eIF3 is also involved in programmed stop codon readthrough

briefDescription: eIF3g subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3)
description: eIF3g subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3); subunit of the core complex of eIF3; is essential for translation; stimulates resumption of ribosomal scanning during translation reinitiation; eIF3 is also involved in programmed stop codon readthrough
functionSummary: Translation initiation factor involved in translational initiation, reinitiation, termination; subunit of multi-eIF and translation initiation factor 3 complexes; localizes to cytoplasmic stress granules
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; in large-scale studies, repression causes an Opi- phenotype (overproduction and excretion of inositol in the absence of inositol and choline), sensitivity to MMS, and reduced competitive fitness; diploid heterozygous null mutant displays elevated innate thermotolerance and lower starvation resistance, and is haploinsufficient

briefDescription: eIF3i subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3)
description: eIF3i subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3); subunit of the core complex of eIF3; essential for translation; stimulates rate of ribosomal scanning during translation reinitiation; eIF3 is also involved in programmed stop codon readthrough

briefDescription: eIF3j component of translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3)
description: eIF3j component of translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3); dual function protein involved in translation initiation as a substoichiometric component (eIF3j) of eIF3; required for 20S pre-rRNA processing; required at post-transcriptional step for efficient retrotransposition; absence decreases Ty1 Gag:GFP protein levels; binds eIF3 subunits Rpg1p, Prt1p and 18S rRNA; eIF3 also involved in programmed stop codon read through; human homolog EIF3J can complement yeast hcr1 mutant
functionSummary: Subunit of translation initiation factor eIF3 involved in cytoplasmic translation initiation and small subunit rRNA processing
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows delays in rRNA processing and reduction in Ty1 transposition, increased resistance to azoles and arsenite but sensitivity to caffeine, MMS, weak acids, tunicamycin; also shows decreased biofilm formation and reduced competitive fitness

briefDescription: eIF4E-associated protein, competes with eIF4G for binding to eIF4E
description: eIF4E-associated protein, competes with eIF4G for binding to eIF4E; accelerates mRNA degradation by promoting decapping, facilitated by interaction with eIF4E; essential for Puf5p mediated repression; associates with Puf5p and Dhh1p; inhibits cap-dependent translation; functions independently of eIF4E to maintain genetic stability; plays a role in cell growth, implicated in the TOR signaling cascade

Eisosome component; likely plays only a minor role in eisosome assembly; shown to interact with Seg1p by affinity purification and mass spec; SWAT-GFP and mCherry fusion proteins localize to the cell periphery; similar to A. gossypii SEG gene which is important for stabilizing eisosomes; SEG2 has a paralog, SEG1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cell periphery

description: Eisosome core component; eisosomes are large immobile cell cortex structures associated with endocytosis; detected in phosphorylated state in mitochondria; phosphorylated on Thr233 upon Pkc1p hyperactivation in a Slt2p MAPK-dependent fashion; null mutant shows activation of Pkc1p/Ypk1p stress resistance pathways; member of BAR domain family; protein increases in abundance and relocalizes from plasma membrane to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress
functionSummary: Lipid-binding protein involved in protein localization, endocytosis and eisosome assembly; also involved in negative regulation of protein kinase activity and the response to heat; localizes to the eisosome
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has an abnormal plasma membrane, with defective eisosome organization and aberrant localization of eisosome proteins; null mutant is sensitive to rapamycin and H2O2, has reduced endocytosis, and has increased innate thermotolerance; in large-scale studies, null mutant has reduced competitive fitness in a variety of different media, is sensitive to osmotic stress, and has altered resistance to a variety of chemicals

description: Eisosome core component; eisosomes are large immobile patch structures at the cell cortex associated with endocytosis; phosphorylated on Thr233 upon Pkc1p hyperactivation in a Slt2p MAPK-dependent fashion; null mutants show activation of Pkc1p/Ypk1p stress resistance pathways; member of the BAR domain family
functionSummary: Lipid-binding protein involved in heat response, endocytosis, and protein kinase inhibition; localizes to plasma membrane, eisosomes, cytoplasm, and outer mitochondrial membrane

description: Elongase; involved in fatty acid and sphingolipid biosynthesis; synthesizes very long chain 20-26-carbon fatty acids from C18-CoA primers; involved in regulation of sphingolipid biosynthesis; lethality of the elo2 elo3 double null mutation is functionally complemented by human ELOVL1 and weakly complemented by human ELOVL3 or ELOV7
functionSummary: Fatty acid elongase involved in very long-chain fatty acid biosynthesis, sphingolipid biosynthesis and late endosome to vacuole transport via the multivesicular body sorting pathway; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum

description: Elongase I, medium-chain acyl elongase; catalyzes carboxy-terminal elongation of unsaturated C12-C16 fatty acyl-CoAs to C16-C18 fatty acids; ELO1 has a paralog, ELO2, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Fatty acid elongase involved in elongation of unsaturated fatty acids; localizes to endoplasmic reticulum

briefDescription: Elongation factor 2 (EF-2), also encoded by EFT1
description: Elongation factor 2 (EF-2), also encoded by EFT1; catalyzes ribosomal translocation during protein synthesis; contains diphthamide, the unique posttranslationally modified histidine residue specifically ADP-ribosylated by diphtheria toxin; EFT2 has a paralog, EFT1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

briefDescription: Elongation factor 2 (EF-2), also encoded by EFT2
description: Elongation factor 2 (EF-2), also encoded by EFT2; catalyzes ribosomal translocation during protein synthesis; contains diphthamide, the unique posttranslationally modified histidine residue specifically ADP-ribosylated by diphtheria toxin; EFT1 has a paralog, EFT2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Elongin A; F-box protein that forms a heterodimer with Elc1p and is required for ubiquitin-dependent degradation of the RNA Polymerase II subunit Rpo21p; subunit of the Elongin-Cullin-Socs (ECS) ligase complex
Elongin C, conserved among eukaryotes; forms a complex with Cul3p that polyubiquitylates monoubiquitylated RNA polymerase II to trigger its proteolysis; plays a role in global genomic repair
Endo-beta-1,3-glucanase; major protein of the cell wall, involved in cell wall maintenance; involved in incorporation of newly synthesized mannoprotein molecules into the cell wall
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays elevated cell wall chitin accumulation and increased sensitivity to cell wall-affecting drugs, Calcofluor White and Congo Red; overexpression causes slow growth; in systematic studies null mutant shows decreased competitive fitness and increased accumulation of free amino acids

description: Endochitinase; required for cell separation after mitosis; transcriptional activation during the G1 phase of the cell cycle is mediated by transcription factor Ace2p
functionSummary: Endochitinase that cleaves internal 1-4-beta bonds between N-acetyl-D-glucosamine moieties within chitin chains; involved in cell separation after cytotokinesis; localized to the cell wall at bud necks and to extracellular region
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation blocks cell separation after mitosis; in systematic studies mutants show reduced anaerobic growth and decreased competitive fitness

briefDescription: Endonuclease involved in DNA recombination and repair
description: Endonuclease involved in DNA recombination and repair; subunit of a complex, with Slx4p, that hydrolyzes 5' branches from duplex DNA in response to stalled or converging replication forks; function overlaps with that of Sgs1p-Top3p

briefDescription: Endonuclease involved in pre-rRNA processing at both ends of ITS2
description: Endonuclease involved in pre-rRNA processing at both ends of ITS2; functions with Grc3p in a conserved mechanism to modulate rRNA processing and ribosome biogenesis; may coordinate the action of the Rat1p-Rai1p exoRNAse; required for the G1/S cell cycle transition; human ortholog is Las1L; mutants require the SSD1-v allele for viability

Endonuclease involved in processing DNA; acts during recombination, repair; promotes template switching during break-induced replication (BIR), causing non-reciprocal translocations (NRTs); cleaves branched structures in complex with Slx1p; involved in interstrand cross-link repair, Rad1p/Rad10p-dependent removal of 3'-nonhomologous tails during DSBR via single-strand annealing; relative distribution to nuclear foci increases upon DNA replication stress; FANCP-related factor
Endonuclease I-SceII; encoded by a mobile group I intron within the mitochondrial COX1 gene; intron is normally spliced by the BI4p maturase but AI4p can mutate to acquire the same maturase activity
Endonuclease I-SceIII; encoded by a mobile group I intron within the mitochondrial COX1 gene
Endonuclease I-SceIV; involved in intron mobility; encoded by a mobile group I intron within the mitochondrial COX1 gene

Endonuclease required for telomere elongation; required for telomeric 5' C-rich strand resection; involved in ds-break repair and processing hairpin DNA structures with the MRX complex; function requires sumoylation and phosphorylation; exists as inactive oligomers that are transiently released into smaller active units by phosphorylation; DNA damage triggers Sae2p removal, so active Sae2p is present only transiently; sequence and functional similarity with human CtIP/RBBP8
functionSummary: Single-stranded DNA endodeoxyribonuclease involved in endonucleolytic DNA catabolism, DNA double-strand break processing, telomere maintenance, and telomeric 3 overhang formation; localizes to the nucleus and cytoplasm in high-throughput studies
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows increased sensitivity to DNA-affecting factors (camptothecin, cisplatin, MMS, gamma rays, UV), decreased mitotic recombination, and increased transposition of Ty transposable elements; homozygous null mutant diploid has low sporulation efficiency

briefDescription: Endonuclease that cleaves pre-rRNA at site A2 for 18S rRNA biogenesis
description: Endonuclease that cleaves pre-rRNA at site A2 for 18S rRNA biogenesis; subunit of U3-containing 90S preribosome processome complex involved in small ribosomal subunit assembly; stimulates Bms1p GTPase and U3 binding activity; similar to RNA cyclase-like proteins but no cyclase activity detected
functionSummary: An endoribonuclease involved in endonucleolytic cleavage during rRNA processing, localized to the nucleuolus

briefDescription: Endoplasmic reticulum (ER) localized integral membrane protein
description: Endoplasmic reticulum (ER) localized integral membrane protein; may promote secretion of certain hexose transporters, including Gal2p; involved in glucose-dependent repression

Endoplasmic reticulum (ER) localized protein; involved in ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD), ER stress, and homeostasis; interacts with components of ERAD-L and ERAD-C and Cdc48p; derlin-like family member similar to Der1p
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant accumulates misfolded substrates for ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD); in systematic studies mutants show reduced competitive fitness and increased levels of intracellular copper and sulfur

description: Endoplasmic reticulum (ER) membrane protein; involved in the translocation of soluble secretory proteins and insertion of membrane proteins into the ER membrane; may also have a role in the stress response but has only partial functional overlap with WSC1-3
functionSummary: Protein transmembrane transporter of the endoplasmic reticulum membraneinvolved in heat response and protein targeting to ER

description: Endoplasmic reticulum (ER) resident protein; required for ER exit of the high-affinity phosphate transporter Pho84p, specifically required for packaging of Pho84p into COPII vesicles; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

Endoplasmic reticulum membrane protein; may facilitate protein-protein interactions between the Erg26p dehydrogenase and the Erg27p 3-ketoreductase and/or tether these enzymes to the ER, also interacts with Erg6p
functionSummary: ER-membrane protein involved in sterol C-4 demethylation during ergosterol biosynthesis
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays slow growth and abnormal sterol distribution; in systematic studies null mutants display random budding pattern, small cell size and sensitivity to multiple chemicals, including miconazole, hydroxyurea, camptothecin, caffeine, ethanol, tetracycline, streptomycin, paromomycin

description: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane protein; required for mannosylation of inositolphosphorylceramide and for growth at high calcium concentrations; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
functionSummary: Regulatory subunit for mannosylinositol phosphorylceramide (MIPC) synthase; required for biosynthesis of mature sphingolipids; integral to the ER membranes
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant accumulates unmannosylated sphingolipids (ceramide and inositol phosphoceramide, IPC) instead of mannosylated forms, MIPC and M(IP)2C; mutants accumulate calcium and show increased sensitivity to extracellular calcium; in systematic studies mutants show decreased competitive fitness and sensitivity to multiple chemicals, including ethanol, acetaldehyde, hydrogen peroxide, hydroxyurea, caffeine, tunicamycin, azoles

briefDescription: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane protein that binds and inhibits Ras2p
description: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane protein that binds and inhibits Ras2p; binds to and inhibits GTP-bound Ras2p at the endoplasmic reticulum (ER); component of the GPI-GnT complex which catalyzes the first step in GPI-anchor biosynthesis; probable homolog of mammalian PIG-Y protein
Endoplasmic reticulum packaging chaperone; required for incorporation of amino acid permeases into COPII coated vesicles for transport to the cell surface
functionSummary: Protein chaperone of endoplasmic reticulum membrane, involved in COPII-coated vesicle budding; also localizes to mating projection tip

description: Endoplasmic reticulum transmembrane protein; may interact with ribosomes, based on co-purification experiments; homolog of human BAP31 protein; YET1 has a paralog, YET2, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum

description: Endoplasmic reticulum zinc transporter; part of a heterodimeric transporter with Msc2p that transfers zinc from the cytosol to the ER lumen; member of the cation diffusion facilitator family of efflux pumps; zinc-regulated directly through Zap1p; transcription induced under conditions of zinc deficiency
functionSummary: Zinc ion transmembrane transporter of the endoplasmic reticulum
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutants are sensitive to starvation, antifungal miconazole, and show decreased competitive fitness; null mutants are resistant to phytogenic insecticide canavanine; homozygous diploid nulls are sensitive to zinc deficiency; heterozygous diploid nulls are haploproficient

description: Endoplasmic reticulum zinc transporter; part of a heterodimeric transporter with Zrg17p that transfers zinc from the cytosol to the ER lumen; member of the cation diffusion facilitator family of efflux pumps; localizes to ER and nucleus; mutations affect the cellular distribution of zinc and also confer defects in meiotic recombination between homologous chromatids
functionSummary: Zinc ion transmembrane transporter involved in cellular zinc homeostasis; localizes to endoplasmic reticulum

description: Endo-polygalacturonase; pectolytic enzyme that hydrolyzes the alpha-1,4-glycosidic bonds in the rhamnogalacturonan chains in pectins
functionSummary: Extracellular polygalacturonase involved in pectin catabolism

description: Endoribonuclease; subunit of the mRNA cleavage and polyadenylation specificity complex; required for 3' processing, splicing, and transcriptional termination of mRNAs and snoRNAs; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; YSH1 has a paralog, SYC1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Endoribonuclease subunit of mRNA cleavage and polyadenylation specificity factor complex; involved in various aspects of RNA processing, including mRNA polyadenylation, pre-mRNA cleavage required for polyadenylation, RNA polymerase II transcription termination, and snoRNA splicing

briefDescription: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins
description: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins; member of the DUP380 subfamily of conserved, often subtelomeric COS genes; required for the multivesicular vesicle body sorting pathway that internalizes plasma membrane proteins for degradation; Cos proteins provide ubiquitin in trans for nonubiquitinated cargo proteins
functionSummary: Protein predicted to have a role in the multivesicular body sorting pathway and to localize to the endosome

briefDescription: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins
description: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins; member of the DUP380 subfamily of conserved, often subtelomeric COS genes; required for the multivesicular vesicle body sorting pathway that internalizes plasma membrane proteins for degradation; Cos proteins provide ubiquitin in trans for nonubiquitinated cargo proteins
functionSummary: Protein predicted to have a role in the multivesicular body sorting pathway and to localize to the endosome
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation lowers competitive fitness and increases replicative lifespan

briefDescription: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins
description: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins; member of the DUP380 subfamily of conserved, often subtelomeric COS genes; required for the multivesicular vesicle body sorting pathway that internalizes plasma membrane proteins for degradation; Cos proteins provide ubiquitin in trans for nonubiquitinated cargo proteins
functionSummary: Protein predicted to have a role in the multivesicular body sorting pathway; localizes to the endosome; detected in the vacuole and vacuole membrane in different large-scale studies
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in systematic studies mutants exhibit increased resistance to organochloride insecticides dieldrin and toxaphene, but increased sensitivity to pentachlorophenol and flucytosine

briefDescription: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins
description: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins; member of the DUP380 subfamily of conserved, often subtelomeric COS genes; required for the multivesicular vesicle body sorting pathway that internalizes plasma membrane proteins for degradation; Cos proteins provide ubiquitin in trans for nonubiquitinated cargo proteins
functionSummary: Protein predicted to have a role in the multivesicular body sorting pathway; localizes to the endosome; detected in the vacuole in a large-scale study

briefDescription: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins
description: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins; member of the DUP380 subfamily of conserved, often subtelomeric COS genes; required for the multivesicular vesicle body sorting pathway that internalizes plasma membrane proteins for degradation; Cos proteins provide ubiquitin in trans for nonubiquitinated cargo proteins
functionSummary: Protein predicted to have a role in the multivesicular body sorting pathway; localizes to the endosome; localizes to the cytoplasm, the nucleus and the vacuole membrane in large-scale studies

briefDescription: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins
description: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins; member of the DUP380 subfamily of conserved, often subtelomeric COS genes; required for the multivesicular vesicle body sorting pathway that internalizes plasma membrane proteins for degradation; Cos proteins provide ubiquitin in trans for nonubiquitinated cargo proteins
functionSummary: Protein predicted to have a role in the multivesicular body sorting pathway; localizes to the endosome; localizes to the vacuole in a large-scale study
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in systematic studies null mutation increases competitive fitness; in strain Sigma1278b null mutation decreases filamentous growth and prevents invasive growth

briefDescription: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins
description: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins; member of the DUP380 subfamily of conserved, often subtelomeric COS genes; required for the multivesicular vesicle body sorting pathway that internalizes plasma membrane proteins for degradation; Cos proteins provide ubiquitin in trans for nonubiquitinated cargo proteins
functionSummary: Protein predicted to have a role in the multivesicular body sorting pathway; localizes to the nuclear envelope; predicted to localize to the endosome

briefDescription: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins
description: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins; member of the DUP380 subfamily of conserved, often subtelomeric COS genes; required for the multivesicular vesicle body sorting pathway that internalizes plasma membrane proteins for degradation; Cos proteins provide ubiquitin in trans for nonubiquitinated cargo proteins
functionSummary: Protein with a role in endocytosis; predicted to be involved in the multivesicular body sorting pathway and to localize to the endosome
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in systematic studies null mutant grows poorly under anaerobic conditions and exhibits elevated sensitivity to sphingolipid-depleting drug myriocin

briefDescription: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins
description: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins; member of the DUP380 subfamily of conserved, often subtelomeric COS genes; required for the multivesicular vesicle body sorting pathway that internalizes plasma membrane proteins for degradation; Cos proteins provide ubiquitin in trans for nonubiquitinated cargo proteins
functionSummary: Protein with a role in sodium ion homeostasis; predicted to have a role in the multivesicular body sorting pathway; localizes to the plasma membrane, endosome, and vacuole
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; both null mutation and overexpression decrease resistance to saline stress; overexpression lowers resistance to rapamycin under competitive growth conditions

briefDescription: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins
description: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins; member of the DUP380 subfamily of conserved, often subtelomeric COS genes; required for the multivesicular vesicle body sorting pathway that internalizes plasma membrane proteins for degradation; Cos proteins provide ubiquitin in trans for nonubiquitinated cargo proteins
functionSummary: Protein with a role in the multivesicular body sorting pathway; localizes to the endosome; detected in the vacuole in a large-scale study

briefDescription: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins
description: Endosomal protein involved in turnover of plasma membrane proteins; member of the DUP380 subfamily of conserved, often subtelomeric COS genes; required for the multivesicular vesicle body sorting pathway that internalizes plasma membrane proteins for degradation; Cos proteins provide ubiquitin in trans for nonubiquitinated cargo proteins; the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies
functionSummary: Putative receptor protein; predicted to have a role in the multivesicular body sorting pathway and to localize to the endosome

description: Endosomal protein of unknown function; contains a phox (PX) homology domain; binds to both phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate (PtdIns(3)P) and proteins involved in ER-Golgi or vesicular transport

briefDescription: Endosomal protein that forms a complex with Hse1p
description: Endosomal protein that forms a complex with Hse1p; required for recycling Golgi proteins, forming lumenal membranes and sorting ubiquitinated proteins destined for degradation; has Ubiquitin Interaction Motifs which bind ubiquitin (Ubi4p)
functionSummary: Subunit of ESCRT-0 complex capable of binding ubiquitin and phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate; involved in protein targeting to vacuole and late endosome to vacuole transport; role in protein retention in Golgi apparatus and ATP export; localizes to endosome
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is defective in vacuolar protein sorting, resulting in decreased processing, missorting, and secretion of hydrolases; endocytic and other intracellular cargo is misdirected to the class E compartment; late endosomes are enlarged in null mutants, and mutants possess decreased stress, metal and toxin resistance; null mutants and overexpressors both have decreased growth rates

briefDescription: Endosomal protein that interacts with phospholipid flippase Drs2p
description: Endosomal protein that interacts with phospholipid flippase Drs2p; interaction with Cdc50p is essential for Drs2p catalytic activity; mutations affect cell polarity and polarized growth; similar to Lem3p; CDC50 has a paralog, YNR048W, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Subunit of the Cdc50p-Drs2p phospolipid flippase complex that is involved in phospholipid translocation, endocytosis and other cellular processes; localizes to the late-golgi and late endosome membrane

description: Endosomal Rab family GTPase; required for endocytic transport and sorting of vacuolar hydrolases; required for endosomal localization of the CORVET complex; required with YPT52 for MVB biogenesis and sorting; involved in autophagy and ionic stress tolerance; geranylgeranylation required for membrane association; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; mammalian Rab5 homolog; VPS21 has a paralog, YPT53, that arose from the whole genome duplication

Endosomal Rab family GTPase; required for vacuolar protein sorting, endocytosis and multivesicular body (MVB) biogenesis and sorting; required for localization of the CORVET complex to endosomes; involved in autophagy and ionic stress tolerance; similar to Vps21p and Ypt53p; mammalian Rab5 homolog; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

briefDescription: Endosomal SNARE related to mammalian syntaxin 8
description: Endosomal SNARE related to mammalian syntaxin 8
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; vacuolar protein import is defective in the null mutant; null mutant has higher resistance to low pH

briefDescription: Endosomal subunit of membrane-associated retromer complex
description: Endosomal subunit of membrane-associated retromer complex; required for retrograde transport; receptor that recognizes retrieval signals on cargo proteins, forms subcomplex with Vps26p and Vps29p that selects cargo proteins for retrieval; interacts with Ypt7p; overexpression of wild-type human VPS35 or Parkinson's-associated vps35-D686N or vps35-P299S variants complements Ni2+ resistance and Cd2+ sensitivity of yeast vps35 null mutant
functionSummary: Endosomal retromer complex subunit involved in retrograde transport of membrane-bounded vesicles from endosomes back to the trans-Golgi network where they are recycled for further rounds of transport
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays chromosome instability, reduced respiratory growth and autophagy, sensitivity to Cd2+, and resistance to Ni2+; mutant accumulates abnormal membrane stacks; in large-scale studies, null mutant shows reduced competitive fitness in several different media, shorter chronological lifespan, abnormal lipid particle morphology, sensitivity to heat and desiccation, and altered resistance to a variety of chemicals

description: Enolase, a phosphopyruvate hydratase; catalyzes the conversion of 2-phosphoglycerate to phosphoenolpyruvate; complements the growth defect of an ENO1 ENO2 double mutant
Enolase, a phosphopyruvate hydratase; catalyzes the conversion of 2-phosphoglycerate to phosphoenolpyruvate; complements the growth defect of an ENO1 ENO2 double mutant in glucose

Enolase I, a phosphopyruvate hydratase; catalyzes conversion of 2-phosphoglycerate to phosphoenolpyruvate during glycolysis and the reverse reaction during gluconeogenesis; expression repressed in response to glucose; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress; N-terminally propionylated in vivo; ENO1 has a paralog, ENO2, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Phosphopyruvate hydratase; catalyzes the hydrolysis of 2-phosphoglycerate to phosphoenolpyruvate during glycolysis and the reverse reaction during gluconeogenesis; localized to mitochondria and vacuoles
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays fragmented vacuoles; in large-scale studies the null mutant exhibits decreased endocytosis and increased competitive fitness; heterozygous null mutant exhibits haploinsufficiency

description: Enolase II, a phosphopyruvate hydratase; catalyzes conversion of 2-phosphoglycerate to phosphoenolpyruvate during glycolysis and the reverse reaction during gluconeogenesis; expression induced in response to glucose; ENO2 has a paralog, ENO1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Phosphopyruvate hydratase; catalyzes the hydrolysis of 2-phosphoglycerate to phosphoenolpyruvate during glycolysis and the reverse reaction during gluconeogenesis; localized to mitochondria and vacuoles
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays fragmented vacuoles; in a large-scale study, overexpression causes a G1 phase delay or arrest

description: Enoyl reductase; catalyzes last step in each cycle of very long chain fatty acid elongation; localizes to ER, highly enriched in a structure marking nuclear-vacuolar junctions; coimmunoprecipitates with elongases Elo2p and Elo3p; protein increases in abundance and relative distribution to ER foci increases upon DNA replication stress; human homolog TECR implicated in nonsyndromic mental retardation, can complement yeast mutant
functionSummary: Oxidoreductase involved in metabolism of very long chain fatty acids, which have a chain length greater than C22; localizes to mitochondria and endoplasmic reticulum membranes
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; ts mutant has smaller piecemeal microautophagy of the nucleus blebs and vesicles; in large-scale studies, repression confers increased competitive fitness, resistance to myriocin, and sensitivity to HU and MMS; overexpression confers slow growth

description: Enzyme of 'de novo' purine biosynthesis; contains both 5-aminoimidazole-4-carboxamide ribonucleotide transformylase and inosine monophosphate cyclohydrolase activities; ADE16 has a paralog, ADE17, that arose from the whole genome duplication; ade16 ade17 mutants require adenine and histidine
functionSummary: Inosine monophosphate (IMP) cyclohydrolase and phosphoribosylaminoimidazolecarboxamide (AICAR) formyltransferase involved in purine nucleotide and 'de novo' IMP biosynthetic processes; localizes to cytosol
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is resistant to cisplatin and shows increased competitive fitness

description: Enzyme of 'de novo' purine biosynthesis; contains both 5-aminoimidazole-4-carboxamide ribonucleotide transformylase and inosine monophosphate cyclohydrolase activities; ADE17 has a paralog, ADE16, that arose from the whole genome duplication; ade16 ade17 mutants require adenine and histidine
functionSummary: Inosine monophosphate (IMP) cyclohydrolase and phosphoribosylaminoimidazolecarboxamide (AICAR) formyltransferase involved in purine nucleotide and 'de novo' IMP biosynthetic processes; localized to the cytosol and the plasma membrane
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is resistant to cisplatin, shows increased chromosome instability and decreased competitive fitness

briefDescription: Enzyme of the 'de novo' purine nucleotide biosynthetic pathway
description: Enzyme of the 'de novo' purine nucleotide biosynthetic pathway; contains aminoimidazole ribotide synthetase and glycinamide ribotide synthetase activities
functionSummary: Putative phosphoribosylamine-glycine ligase and phosphoribosylformylglycinamidine cyclo-ligase likely to be involved in purine nucleobase metabolic process; localized to the cytoplasm
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays adenine auxotrophy; in large-scale studies null mutant shows decreased competitive fitness, shortened chronological lifespan and lower innate thermotolerance

description: Enzyme regulator; involved in synthesis of phosphatidylinositol 3,5-bisphosphate, in control of trafficking of some proteins to the vacuole lumen via the MVB, and in maintenance of vacuole size and acidity; binds negative (Fig4p) and positive (Fab1p) regulators of PtdIns(3,5)P(2) to control endolysosome function; similar to mammalian Vac14p

briefDescription: Enzyme that catalyzes the fourth step in the histidine pathway
description: Enzyme that catalyzes the fourth step in the histidine pathway; Phosphoribosylformimino-5-aminoimidazole carboxamide ribotide isomerase; mutations cause histidine auxotrophy and sensitivity to Cu, Co, and Ni salts

briefDescription: Enzyme that mediates the conjugation of Rub1p
description: Enzyme that mediates the conjugation of Rub1p; a ubiquitin-like protein, to other proteins; related to E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzymes
Epoxide hydrolase; member of the alpha/beta hydrolase fold family; may have a role in detoxification of epoxides
functionSummary: Epoxide hydrolase involved in metabolism of cyclic ethers; cellular localization not yet determined

description: Epsilon-COP subunit of the coatomer; regulates retrograde Golgi-to-ER protein traffic; stabilizes Cop1p, the alpha-COP and the coatomer complex; non-essential for cell growth; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

briefDescription: Epsilon subunit of the F1 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase
description: Epsilon subunit of the F1 sector of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase; which is a large, evolutionarily conserved enzyme complex required for ATP synthesis; F1 translationally regulates ATP6 and ATP8 expression to achieve a balanced output of ATP synthase genes encoded in nucleus and mitochondria; phosphorylated
functionSummary: Subunit of the central stalk of the F1 catalytic core of mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase; ATP synthase complex is localized to the mitochondrial inner membrane
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is unable to grow on non-fermentable carbon sources, indicating respiratory growth defect; in systematic studies null mutants are sensitive to Congo Red, MMS, rapamycin, but resistant to miconazole, and show reduced competitive fitness

briefDescription: Epsilon subunit of the oligosaccharyltransferase complex
description: Epsilon subunit of the oligosaccharyltransferase complex; located in the ER lumen; catalyzes asparagine-linked glycosylation of newly synthesized proteins

briefDescription: Epsin-like protein involved in endocytosis and actin patch assembly
description: Epsin-like protein involved in endocytosis and actin patch assembly; functionally redundant with Ent2p; binds clathrin via a clathrin-binding domain motif at C-terminus; relocalizes from bud neck to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress; ENT1 has a paralog, ENT2, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Clathrin and ubiquitin binding protein; localizes to the early endosome; involved in actin filament organization and actin patch assembly, and endocytosis

briefDescription: Epsin-like protein required for endocytosis and actin patch assembly
description: Epsin-like protein required for endocytosis and actin patch assembly; functionally redundant with Ent1p; contains clathrin-binding motif at C-terminus; ENT2 has a paralog, ENT1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Clathrin binding protein, that localizes to the mating projection tip; involved in actin filament organization and actin patch assembly, and endocytosis

description: ER associated glutathione S-transferase; capable of homodimerization; glutathione transferase for Yvc1p vacuolar cation channel; expression induced during the diauxic shift and throughout stationary phase; functional overlap with Gtt2p, Grx1p, and Grx2p

briefDescription: ER integral membrane protein, ERMES complex subunit
description: ER integral membrane protein, ERMES complex subunit; ERMES links the ER to mitochondria and may promote inter-organellar calcium and phospholipid exchange as well as coordinating mitochondrial DNA replication and growth; required for mitophagy; ERMES complex is often co-localized with peroxisomes and with concentrated areas of pyruvate dehydrogenase
functionSummary: Protein involved in mitochondrial genome maintenance, mitochondrion to ER tethering, assembly of the mitochondrial outer membrane translocase complex, and phosolipid transport; part of the ERMES complex and localized to both mitochondrial outer membrane and ER membrane
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant exhibits mitochondrial defects including the inability to respire, reduced mitophagy, decreased mitochondrial cardiolipin and phosphatidylethanolamine accumulation and increased ergosterol accumulation; temperature-sensitive mutant has giant, condensed mitochondria at elevated temperatures; in large-scale studies, null mutant displays decreases in competitive fitness, filamentous growth, and chronological lifespan, and altered resistance to various chemicals

description: ER localized heme oxygenase; involved in heme degradation during iron starvation and in the oxidative stress response; expression is regulated by AFT1 and oxidative stress; relocates to the perinuclear region in the presence of oxidants
functionSummary: Heme oxygenase involved in the oxidative stress response, heme catabolism and cellular iron homeostasis; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum and the outer nuclear membrane

description: ER-localized protein of unknown function
functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum in a large-scale study

briefDescription: ER membrane glycoprotein subunit of the GPI transamidase complex
description: ER membrane glycoprotein subunit of the GPI transamidase complex; adds glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchors to newly synthesized proteins; human PIG-K protein is a functional homolog
functionSummary: GPI-anchor transamidase subunit of GPI-anchor transamidase complex; involved in attachment of GPI anchor to protein
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; repression of expression causes actin cytoskeletal abnormalities; in large-scale studies, mutants show slow growth rate and increased telomere length and K28 killer toxin resistance

description: ER membrane localized phosphoryltransferase; adds phosphoethanolamine onto the third mannose residue of the glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor precursor; similar to human PIG-O protein
functionSummary: Mannose-ethanolamine phosphotransferase involved in GPI anchor biosynthesis in the endoplasmic reticulum
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; in large-scale studies, repression of expression causes decreased competitive fitness; heterozygous null mutant has lower starvation resistance and is haploinsufficient

description: ER-membrane protein; subunit of evolutionarily conserved EMC (Endoplasmic Reticulum Membrane Complex) implicated in ERAD (ER-associated degradation) and proper assembly of multi-pass transmembrane (TM) proteins; EMC acts in yeast as an ER-mitochondria tether that interacts with outer membrane protein Tom5 of TOM (Translocase of the Mitochondrial Outer Membrane) complex; suppressor of pma1-7, deletion of SOP4 slows down export of wild-type Pma1p and Pma1-7 from the ER

briefDescription: ER membrane protein involved in a late step of GPI anchor assembly
description: ER membrane protein involved in a late step of GPI anchor assembly; involved in the addition of phosphoethanolamine to the multiply mannosylated glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) intermediate; human PIG-Fp is a functional homolog
functionSummary: Mannose-ethanolamine phosphotransferase involved in GPI anchor biosynthesis in the endoplasmic reticulum membrane
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; in large-scale studies, repression of expression causes increased competitive fitness, abnormal mitochondrial morphology, sensitivity to HU, and cytokinesis defects; heterozygous null mutant has lower starvation resistance and is haploinsufficient

briefDescription: ER membrane protein involved in regulation of OLE1 transcription
description: ER membrane protein involved in regulation of OLE1 transcription; inactive ER form dimerizes and one subunit is then activated by ubiquitin/proteasome-dependent processing followed by nuclear targeting; MGA2 has a paralog, SPT23, that arose from the whole genome duplication

briefDescription: ER membrane protein involved in regulation of OLE1 transcription
description: ER membrane protein involved in regulation of OLE1 transcription; inactive ER form dimerizes and one subunit is then activated by ubiquitin/proteasome-dependent processing followed by nuclear targeting; SPT23 has a paralog, MGA2, that arose from the whole genome duplication

briefDescription: ER membrane protein involved in the second step of GPI anchor assembly
description: ER membrane protein involved in the second step of GPI anchor assembly; the second step is the de-N-acetylation of the N-acetylglucosaminylphosphatidylinositol intermediate; functional homolog of human PIG-Lp; GPI stands for glycosylphosphatidylinositol
functionSummary: N-acetylglucosaminylphosphatidylinositol deacetylase involved in GPI anchor biosynthesis; localizes to cytoplasm, endoplasmic reticulum, and putatively integral to membrane in high-throughput studies
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; in large-scale studies, repression of expression causes decreased competitive fitness and confers Opi- phenotype (overproduction and excretion of inositol in the absence of inositol and choline); overexpression enhances filamentous growth; conditional mutant exhibits increased resistance to K28 killer toxin

briefDescription: ER membrane protein that plays a central role in ERAD
description: ER membrane protein that plays a central role in ERAD; forms HRD complex with Hrd1p and ER-associated protein degradation (ERAD) determinants that engages in lumen to cytosol communication and coordination of ERAD events

briefDescription: ER membrane protein that promotes export of misfolded polypeptides
description: ER membrane protein that promotes export of misfolded polypeptides; required for ER-associated protein degradation of misfolded or unassembled proteins; initiates export of aberrant polypeptides from ER lumen by threading them into ER membrane and routing them to Hrd1p for ubiquitination; function normally requires N-terminal acetylation by NatB; N- and C- termini protrude into cytoplasm; similar to Dfm1p; homolog of mammalian derlin-1
functionSummary: Protein that binds misfolded proteins in the ER and directs them to ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway in cytoplasm for degradation; localized in the ER membrane
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation results in increased prion formation and increased replicative lifespan; mutants in systematic studies show increased sensitivity to myriocin and quinine

briefDescription: ER protein involved in ER-plasma membrane tethering
description: ER protein involved in ER-plasma membrane tethering; one of 6 proteins (Ist2p, Scs2p, Scs22p, Tcb1p, Tcb2p, Tcb3p) that connect ER to plasma membrane (PM) and regulate PM phosphatidylinositol-4-phosphate (PI4P) levels by controlling access of Sac1p phosphatase to its substrate PI4P in the PM; contains 3 calcium and lipid binding domains; mRNA is targeted to bud; TCB2 has a paralog, TCB1, that arose from the whole genome duplication

briefDescription: ER protein that functions in assembly of the V0 sector of V-ATPase
description: ER protein that functions in assembly of the V0 sector of V-ATPase; functions with other assembly factors; null mutation enhances the vacuolar ATPase (V-ATPase) deficiency of a vma21 mutant impaired in endoplasmic reticulum (ER) retrieval

briefDescription: ER protein with chaperone and co-chaperone activity
description: ER protein with chaperone and co-chaperone activity; involved in retention of resident ER proteins; has a role in recognizing proteins targeted for ER-associated degradation (ERAD), member of the protein disulfide isomerase family

ER quality-control lectin; integral subunit of the HRD ligase; participates in efficient ER retention of misfolded proteins by recognizing them and delivering them to Hrd1p; binds to glycans with terminal alpha-1,6 linked mannose on misfolded N-glycosylated proteins and participates in targeting proteins to ERAD; member of the OS-9 protein family

briefDescription: ER-resident protein involved in peroxisomal biogenesis
description: ER-resident protein involved in peroxisomal biogenesis; ER-localized protein that associates with peroxisomes; interacts with Pex29p and reticulons Rtn1p and Yop1p to regulate peroxisome biogenesis from the ER; role in peroxisomal-destined vesicular flow from the ER; partially redundant with Pex31p; may function at a step downstream of steps mediated by Pex28p and Pex29p; PEX30 has a paralog, PEX31, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Endoplasmic reticulum and peroxisomal membrane protein involved in ER membrane tubulation for the ER-derived biogenesis of peroxisomes

briefDescription: ER-resident protein involved in peroxisomal biogenesis
description: ER-resident protein involved in peroxisomal biogenesis; ER-localized protein that associates with peroxisomes; interacts with Pex30p and reticulons Rtn1p and Yop1p to regulate peroxisome biogenesis from the ER; role in peroxisomal-destined vesicular flow from the ER; regulates peroxisomal size, number and distribution; Pex28p and Pex29p may act at steps upstream of those mediated by Pex30p, Pex31p, and Pex32p; forms ER foci upon DNA replication stress
functionSummary: Endoplasmic reticulum and peroxisomal membrane protein involved in the organization and ER-derived biogenesis of peroxisomes

briefDescription: ESCRT-I subunit required to stabilize ESCRT-I core complex oligomers
description: ESCRT-I subunit required to stabilize ESCRT-I core complex oligomers; the ESCRT-I core complex (Stp22p, Vps28p, Srn2p) is involved in ubiquitin-dependent sorting of proteins into the endosome; deletion mutant is sensitive to rapamycin and nystatin

briefDescription: Essential 100kDa subunit of the exocyst complex
description: Essential 100kDa subunit of the exocyst complex; the exocyst mediates polarized targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles to active sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane prior to SNARE-mediated fusion
functionSummary: Subunit of the exocyst complex which mediates the targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles containing exocytic cargo to sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane

briefDescription: Essential 107kDa subunit of the exocyst complex
description: Essential 107kDa subunit of the exocyst complex; the exocyst mediates polarized targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles to active sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane prior to SNARE-mediated fusion; involved in assembly of the exocyst complex; required with Sec3p for ER inheritance where it promotes anchoring of the cortical ER at the bud tip
functionSummary: Subunit of the exocyst complex which mediates the targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles containing exocytic cargo to sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane; involved in exocyst assembly and ER inheritance; localizes to sites of polarized growth

briefDescription: Essential 113 kDa subunit of the exocyst complex
description: Essential 113 kDa subunit of the exocyst complex; the exocyst mediates polarized targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles to active sites of exocytosis prior to SNARE-mediated fusion; interacts with and functions as a downstream effector of active, GTP-bound Sec4p, a Rab family GTPase
functionSummary: Subunit of the exocyst complex which mediates the targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles containing exocytic cargo to sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane; interacts directly with the active, GTP-bound form of Sec4 (Rab GTPase); localizes to sites of polarized growth

briefDescription: Essential 121 kDa subunit of the exocyst complex
description: Essential 121 kDa subunit of the exocyst complex; the exocyst mediates polarized targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles to active sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane prior to SNARE-mediated fusion; involved in ER and Golgi inheritance in small buds; relocalizes away from bud neck upon DNA replication stress
functionSummary: Subunit of the exocyst complex which mediates the targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles containing exocytic cargo to sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane; involved in ER and Golgi inheritance; localizes to sites of polarized growth

description: Essential 18S rRNA dimethylase (dimethyladenosine transferase); responsible for conserved m6(2)Am6(2)A dimethylation in 3'-terminal loop of 18S rRNA, part of 90S and 40S pre-particles in nucleolus, involved in pre-ribosomal RNA processing; human homolog DIMT1 complements yeast dim1 mutant
functionSummary: Putative rRNA (adenine-N6,N6-)-dimethyltransferase; contributes to the maturation of SSU-ribosomal RNA (rRNA) from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA) and rRNA modification; localizes to 90S preribosome in high-throughput studies
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional mutants have opi- phenotype (excretion of inositol in the absence of inositol and choline); overexpression causes slow growth

briefDescription: Essential 3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydratase of the ER membrane
description: Essential 3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydratase of the ER membrane; involved in elongation of very long-chain fatty acids; evolutionarily conserved, similar to mammalian PTPLA and PTPLB; involved in sphingolipid biosynthesis and protein trafficking

briefDescription: Essential 88kDa subunit of the exocyst complex
description: Essential 88kDa subunit of the exocyst complex; the exocyst mediates polarized targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles to active sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane prior to SNARE-mediated fusion; anchors the assembled complex to sites of secretion; interacts with SM-like protein and SNARE regulator Sec1p and may recruit it to sites of secretion; binds to SNARE complexes binteracting with Sec9p
functionSummary: Subunit of the exocyst complex which mediates the targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles containing exocytic cargo to sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane; interacts with SNARE complex; localizes to sites of polarized growth

briefDescription: Essential alpha-kleisin subunit of the cohesin complex
description: Essential alpha-kleisin subunit of the cohesin complex; required for sister chromatid cohesion in mitosis; subject to proteolytic cleavage by separate Esp1p, resulting in dissociation of cohesin from chromatin and the separation of sister chromatids at the mitotic metaphase-to-anaphase transition; apoptosis induces cleavage and translocation of a C-terminal fragment to mitochondria; expression peaks in S phase
functionSummary: Subunit of the nuclear mitotic cohesion complex; binds chromatin; involved in establishment of mitotic sister chromatid cohesion and mitotic chromosome condensation; involved in DNA unwinding during DNA replication, DNA damage response, double-strand break repair, and apoptosis
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional mutant has a mitotic delay, with loss of viability, chromosome segregation defects, and chromosomal instability; conditional mutant has increased sensitivity to UV radiation, gamma rays and nocodazole and abnormal spindle morphology

briefDescription: Essential ATP-binding protein required for DNA replication
description: Essential ATP-binding protein required for DNA replication; component of the pre-replicative complex (pre-RC) which requires ORC to associate with chromatin and is in turn required for Mcm2-7p DNA association; homologous to S. pombe Cdc18p; relocalizes from nucleus to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress; degraded in response to plasma membrane stress
functionSummary: ATPase and GTPase; binds chromatin and DNA replication origins; involved in G1/S transition of the mitotic cell cycle and pre-replicative complex assembly during DNA replication; regulates DNA replication initiation and chromatin silencing at telomeres; subunit of the nuclear pre-replicative complex and the DNA replication preinitiation complex
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; repressible mutant arrests in S phase with partially replicated DNA; conditional mutant arrests with large budded cells and nuclei situated at the mother-bud neck; conditional mutant displays chromosomal instability with an elevated rate of chromosome loss and gross chromosomal rearrangements at semi-permissive temperatures; conditional mutant displays an increased mutation frequency at permissive temperature; overexpression results in a decreased rate of vegetative growth

briefDescription: Essential beta-coat protein of the COPI coatomer
description: Essential beta-coat protein of the COPI coatomer; involved in ER-to-Golgi protein trafficking and maintenance of normal ER morphology; shares 43% sequence identity with mammalian beta-coat protein (beta-COP)

briefDescription: Essential beta'-coat protein of the COPI coatomer
description: Essential beta'-coat protein of the COPI coatomer; involved in ER-to-Golgi and Golgi-to-ER transport; contains WD40 domains that mediate cargo selective interactions; 45% sequence identity to mammalian beta'-COP

Essential chromatin-associated protein; involved in initiation of DNA replication; required for association of MCM2-7 complex with replication origins; required to stabilize catalytic subunit of DNA polymerase-alpha; self-associates through its N-terminal domain
functionSummary: DNA replication origin-binding protein involved in DNA replication, double-strand break repair, and chromatin silencing

briefDescription: Essential component of CPF (cleavage and polyadenylation factor)
description: Essential component of CPF (cleavage and polyadenylation factor); involved in 3' end formation of snoRNA and mRNA; interacts directly with Pta1p; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia; similar to mammalian Cleavage-Stimulation Factor CstF-64

Essential component of GPI-mannosyltransferase II; complex is responsible for second mannose addition to GPI precursors as a partner of Gpi18p; required for maturation of Gas1p and Pho8p; has synthetic genetic interactions with secretory pathway genes

briefDescription: Essential component of the Arp2/3 complex
description: Essential component of the Arp2/3 complex; Arp2/3 is a highly conserved actin nucleation center required for the motility and integrity of actin patches; involved in endocytosis and membrane growth and polarity
phenotypeSummary: Essential/non-essential gene; null mutant has been reported to be either viable, poorly germinating and slow growing or inviable in S288C; conditional mutant arrests randomly and loses viability at elevated temperature; conditional mutant exhibits decreased actin-cortical patch motility, accumulates aggregates and immobile cables, and replaces cortical actin patches by bundle-like structures; conditional mutant is benomyl sensitive; reduction of function allele has decreased telomere length; heterozygous diploid null is haploinsufficient

briefDescription: Essential component of the Arp2/3 complex
description: Essential component of the Arp2/3 complex; Arp2/3 is a highly conserved actin nucleation center required for the motility and integrity of actin patches; involved in endocytosis and membrane growth and polarity; required for efficient Golgi-to-ER trafficking in COPI mutants
phenotypeSummary: Essential/non-essential gene; null mutant has been reported to be either viable and slow growing or inviable in S288C; conditional mutant arrests non-uniformly and loses viability; conditional mutant displays abnormal actin cytoskeleton morphology, abnormal bud morphology, a random budding pattern in both haploids and diploids, abnormal chitin deposition, defective endocytosis and sensitivity to hyperosmotic stress; conditional mutant displays decreased mitochondrial movement velocity, loss of directed movement, and abnormal mitochondrial morphology; homozygous conditional diploid has a defect in spore wall formation and a severe sporulation defect; hypomorphic DAmP allele has reduced telomere length

briefDescription: Essential component of the conserved oligomeric Golgi complex
description: Essential component of the conserved oligomeric Golgi complex; a cytosolic tethering complex (Cog1p through Cog8p) that functions in protein trafficking to mediate fusion of transport vesicles to Golgi compartments
functionSummary: Bridging protein involved in the Golgi organization, retrograde transport and CVT pathways; localizes to the Golgi transport complex
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant exhibits slow growth and heat sensitivity; in systematic studies mutants show decreased anaerobic growth, abnormally round buds and shorter chronological lifespan

briefDescription: Essential component of the conserved oligomeric Golgi complex
description: Essential component of the conserved oligomeric Golgi complex; a cytosolic tethering complex (Cog1p through Cog8p) that functions in protein trafficking to mediate fusion of transport vesicles to Golgi compartments
functionSummary: Protein involved in vesicle transport within the Golgi and between Golgi and ER; also involved in CVT pathway, macroautophagy and pexophagy; part of the Golgi transport complex
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; repression causes delays in vacuolar transport; reduction of function confers sensitivity to MMS

briefDescription: Essential component of the conserved oligomeric Golgi complex
description: Essential component of the conserved oligomeric Golgi complex; a cytosolic tethering complex (Cog1p through Cog8p) that functions in protein trafficking to mediate fusion of transport vesicles to Golgi compartments
functionSummary: Protein transporter involved in vesicle transport within the Golgi and between Golgi and ER; also involved in CVT pathway, macroautophagy and pexophagy; part of the Golgi transport complex
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene in a systematic study; mutants show severely decreased growth rate and defects in protein secretion and vacuolar transport; haploinsufficient, heterozygous null mutant diploids have chromosome instability and hypersensitivity to several drugs, including aureobasidin A, rapamycin and others

briefDescription: Essential component of the conserved oligomeric Golgi complex
description: Essential component of the conserved oligomeric Golgi complex; a cytosolic tethering complex that functions in protein trafficking to mediate fusion of transport vesicles to Golgi compartments; the components of the Golgi complex are Gog1p through Cog8p
functionSummary: Protein involved in vesicle transport within the Golgi and between Golgi and ER; also involved in CVT pathway, macroautophagy and pexophagy; part of the Golgi transport complex and localizes to membranes
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene in a systematic study; null mutant has severely decreased growth rate at normal temperatures and fails to grow at reduced temperatures

briefDescription: Essential component of the MIND kinetochore complex
description: Essential component of the MIND kinetochore complex; joins kinetochore subunits contacting DNA to those contacting microtubules; critical to kinetochore assembly; complex consists of Mtw1p Including Nnf1p-Nsl1p-Dsn1p (MIND)
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; heterozygous null mutant displays decreased fitness; conditional mutant is heat-sensitive and shows chromosome instability (CIN); reduced expression causes increased DNA damage and chromosome instability

briefDescription: Essential component of the MIND kinetochore complex
description: Essential component of the MIND kinetochore complex; joins kinetochore subunits contacting DNA to those contacting microtubules; required for accurate chromosome segregation; complex consists of Mtw1p Including Nnf1p-Nsl1p-Dsn1p (MIND)

briefDescription: Essential component of the outer kinetochore MIND complex
description: Essential component of the outer kinetochore MIND complex; joins kinetochore subunits contacting DNA to those contacting microtubules; phosphorylation promotes interaction between outer and inner kinetochore proteins; kinetochore receptor for monopolin, via interaction with Csm1p; essential for both meiotic and mitotic chromosome segregation; MIND complex consists of Mtw1p, Nnf1p, Nsl1p and Dsn1p; phosphorylated by monopolin subunit, Hrr25p and Aurora kinase, Ipl1p; modified by sumoylation
functionSummary: Subunit of nuclear MIS12/MIND complex required for the spindle checkpoint and kinetochore integrity; involved in attachment of spindle microtubules to kinetochore during homologous chromosome segregation
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional (ts) mutant is defective in chromosome segregation; in systematic studies reduction-of-function mutations lead to cell cycle arrest at G2 phase and chromosome instability

briefDescription: Essential component of the outer kinetochore MIND complex
description: Essential component of the outer kinetochore MIND complex; joins kinetochore subunits contacting DNA to those contacting microtubules; required for kinetochore bi-orientation and accurate chromosome segregation; complex consists of Mtw1p, Nnf1p, Nsl1p and Dsn1p; homologous to metazoan CENP-H proteins

briefDescription: Essential component of the Rpd3S histone deacetylase complex
description: Essential component of the Rpd3S histone deacetylase complex; interacts with Eaf3p

briefDescription: Essential component of the TIM23 complex
description: Essential component of the TIM23 complex; acts as receptor for the translocase of the inner mitochondrial membrane (TIM23) complex guiding incoming precursors from the TOM complex; may control the gating of the Tim23p-Tim17p channel

briefDescription: Essential component of the TIM23 complex
description: Essential component of the TIM23 complex; involved in protein import into mitochondrial matrix and inner membrane; with Tim17p, contributes to architecture and function of the import channel; TIM23 complex is short for the translocase of the inner mitochondrial membrane

briefDescription: Essential component of the TIM23 complex
description: Essential component of the TIM23 complex; tethers the import motor and regulatory factors (PAM complex) to the translocation channel (Tim23p-Tim17p core complex); TIM23 complex is short for the translocase of the inner mitochondrial membrane

briefDescription: Essential component of the TIM23 complex
description: Essential component of the TIM23 complex; with Tim23p, contributes to the architecture and function of the import channel; may link the import motor to the core Translocase of the Inner Mitochondrial membrane (TIM23 complex)

briefDescription: Essential conserved protein with a role in cell wall integrity
description: Essential conserved protein with a role in cell wall integrity; contains six TPR (tetratricopeptide repeat) domains clustered in the C-terminal region; conditional mutant is suppressed by overexpression of GFA1; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

briefDescription: Essential conserved small ribosomal subunit (40s) synthesis factor
description: Essential conserved small ribosomal subunit (40s) synthesis factor; component of the 90S preribosome; required for production of 18S rRNA and small ribosomal subunit; contains five consensus RNA-binding domains and binds to the pre-rRNA at two sites within the 18S region

briefDescription: Essential conserved subunit of CPF cleavage and polyadenylation factor
description: Essential conserved subunit of CPF cleavage and polyadenylation factor; plays a role in 3' end formation of mRNA via the specific cleavage and polyadenylation of pre-mRNA; contains a ubiquitin-like (UBL) domain, a RNA-binding zinc knuckle motif and a RING finger domain; both the zinc knuckle and RING finger are required for pre-mRNA binding; possible role in ubiquitination of Pap1p; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia
functionSummary: Pre-mRNA binding subunit of the mRNA cleavage and polyadenylation specificity factor complex; involved in mRNA polyadenylation, pre-mRNA cleavage required for polyadenylation, and protein ubiquitination; localizes to both nucleus and cytosol

briefDescription: Essential core component of the mitochondrial TIM22 complex
description: Essential core component of the mitochondrial TIM22 complex; involved in insertion of polytopic proteins into the inner membrane; forms the channel through which proteins are imported
functionSummary: Protein channel that binds mitochondrial targeting peptide sequences to localize proteins within mitochondria; subunit of the Tim22 complex which is embedded in the mitochondrial inner membrane and mediates insertion of carrier proteins into the inner membrane
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; mutations cause reduced accumulation of mitochondrial proteins; in large-scale studies, repression confers sensitivity to MMS and resistance to myriocin; diploid heterozygous null mutant displays chromosome instability and is sensitive to ethidium bromide

briefDescription: Essential cytoplasmic iron-sulfur cluster binding protein
description: Essential cytoplasmic iron-sulfur cluster binding protein; forms a complex with Cfd1p that is involved in iron-sulfur protein assembly in the cytosol; similar to P-loop NTPases

briefDescription: Essential DEAH-box ATP-dependent RNA helicase specific to U3 snoRNP
description: Essential DEAH-box ATP-dependent RNA helicase specific to U3 snoRNP; predominantly nucleolar in distribution; required for 18S rRNA synthesis

briefDescription: Essential DNA-binding transcription regulator that binds many loci
description: Essential DNA-binding transcription regulator that binds many loci; involved in transcription activation, repression, chromatin silencing, telomere length maintenance; relocalizes to cytosol under hypoxia; conserved protein with N-terminal BRCT domain, central region with homology to Myb DNA binding domain, and C-terminal Rap1-specific protein-interaction domain (RCT domain); recruits Sir complex to telomeric DNA; present in quiescent cell telomere hyperclusters
functionSummary: Sequence specific DNA-binding RNA polymerase II transcription activator and repressor; activates expression of genes involved in glycolysis; involved in chromatin silencing, establishment of protein localization to chromatin and telomere maintenance; localizes to the cytosol and nucleus
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; reduced function mutants have decreased fitness, long telomeres increased telomeric silencing, and are sensitive to DNA-damaging agent MMS; overexpression slows growth

description: Essential evolutionarily conserved nucleolar protein; necessary for biogenesis of 60S ribosomal subunits and for processing of pre-rRNAs to mature rRNA; associated with several distinct 66S pre-ribosomal particles

Essential evolutionarily-conserved nucleolar protein; component of the box C/D snoRNP complexes that direct 2'-O-methylation of pre-rRNA during its maturation; overexpression causes spindle orientation defects

Essential Fe-S protein; required for ribosome biogenesis, translation initiation/termination; facilitates binding of multifactor complex (MFC) of initiation factors to small ribosomal subunit; Dom34-Hbs1 complex and Rli1p work in dissociating inactive ribosomes, thereby facilitating translation restart; forms complex with Lto1p and Yae1p; dependency on ROS-labile FeS clusters, activity in nuclear ribosomal-subunit export impaired by mild oxidative stress

briefDescription: Essential helicase component of heterohexameric MCM2-7 complexes
description: Essential helicase component of heterohexameric MCM2-7 complexes; MCM2-7 complexes bind pre-replication complexes on DNA and melt DNA prior to replication; forms an Mcm4p-6p-7p subcomplex; shows nuclear accumulation in G1; homolog of S. pombe Cdc21p
functionSummary: Component of the MCM mini-chromosome maintenance complex involved in initiation and regulation of DNA replication; also involved in pre-replicative complex assembly and double-strand break repair; binds DNA replication origins and single-stranded DNA

description: Essential Hsp90p co-chaperone; necessary for passage through the START phase of the cell cycle; stabilizes protein kinase nascent chains and participates along with Hsp90p in their folding

Essential kinetochore protein; component of the CBF3 complex that binds the CDEIII region of the centromere; contains an N-terminal Zn2Cys6 type zinc finger domain, a C-terminal acidic domain, and a putative coiled coil dimerization domain
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional (ts) mutants arrest cell cycle with abnormal spindles and undivided nuclei; repression leads to abnormal mitochondrial morphology

description: Essential kinetochore protein; component of the CBF3 multisubunit complex that binds to the CDEIII region of the centromere; Cbf2p also binds to the CDEII region possibly forming a different multimeric complex, ubiquitinated in vivo; sumoylated in an Mms21p-dependent manner; relative distribution to the spindle pole body decreases upon DNA replication stress
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional (ts) mutants show abnormal spindle morphology and elevated chromosome instability; overexpression causes slow growth and increased chromosome loss and rearrangements

briefDescription: Essential kinetochore protein associated with microtubules and SPBs
description: Essential kinetochore protein associated with microtubules and SPBs; component of the kinetochore sub-complex COMA (Ctf19p, Okp1p, Mcm21p, Ame1p); involved in spindle checkpoint maintenance; orthologous to human centromere constitutive-associated network (CCAN) subunit CENP-U and fission yeast Mis17; relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional mutant is heat sensitive, arresting in anaphase at the restrictive temperature, and displays reduced vegetative growth at permissive temperatures; conditional, repressible and heterozygous null mutants display chromosomal instability, including elevated chromosome loss and chromosomal rearrangements; overexpression results in the accumulation of large-budded cells with 2C DNA content, indicative of a G2 or M phase delay or arrest

description: Essential light chain for Myo1p; light chain for Myo2p; stabilizes Myo2p by binding to the neck region; interacts with Myo1p, Iqg1p, and Myo2p to coordinate formation and contraction of the actomyosin ring with targeted membrane deposition

briefDescription: Essential membrane protein localized at nuclear envelope and SPBs
description: Essential membrane protein localized at nuclear envelope and SPBs; required for insertion of the newly duplicated spindle pole body into the nuclear envelope; potentially phosphorylated by Cdc28p; MPS2 has a paralog, CSM4, that arose from the whole genome duplication
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional mutant has abnormal spindle morphology with disorganized microtubule arrays, a dysfunctional monopolar spindle with a second, defective SPB, arresting as large-budded cells in G2 phase, and becoming polyploid due to chromosome missegregation; overexpression results in accumulation of cells with medium to large buds in G2 phase, and inviability; heterozygous diploid null is haploinsufficient

description: Essential N-acetylglucosamine-phosphate mutase; converts GlcNAc-6-P to GlcNAc-1-P, which is a precursor for the biosynthesis of chitin and for the formation of N-glycosylated mannoproteins and glycosylphosphatidylinositol anchors
functionSummary: Phosphoacetylglucosamine mutase that contributes to cell wall chitin synthesis; localizes to nucleus and cytoplasm in high throughput studies
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; reduction of function causes sensitivity to starvation and several chemicals, such as benomyl, hydroxyurea, MMS, rapamycin

briefDescription: Essential non-ATPase regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome
description: Essential non-ATPase regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome; has similarity to the human p40 proteasomal subunit and to another S. cerevisiae regulatory subunit, Rpn11p
functionSummary: Peripheral lid subunit of proteasome regulatory particle involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein degradation
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; repression leads to abnormal mitochondrial morphology; reduction of function causes decreased competitive fitness

briefDescription: Essential non-ATPase regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome
description: Essential non-ATPase regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome; similar to another S. cerevisiae regulatory subunit, Rpn5p, as well as to mammalian proteasome subunits
functionSummary: Structural molecule of proteasome regulatory particle involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein degradation; subunit of proteasomal peripheral lid subcomplex
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional (ts) mutants accumulate polyubiquitinated proteins and show abnormal cell cycle transition through G2/M phase and increased cell size

briefDescription: Essential non-ATPase regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome lid
description: Essential non-ATPase regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome lid; similar to the p58 subunit of the human 26S proteasome; temperature-sensitive alleles cause metaphase arrest, suggesting a role for the proteasome in cell cycle control
functionSummary: Peripheral lid subunit of proteasome regulatory particle involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein degradation
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; reduction of function causes senstitvity to MMS and hydroxyurea, and decreased competitive fitness; repression increased resistance to myriocin

briefDescription: Essential, non-ATPase regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome lid
description: Essential, non-ATPase regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome lid; required for the assembly and activity of the 26S proteasome; the human homolog (S9 protein) partially rescues Rpn6p depletion; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

briefDescription: Essential NTPase required for small ribosome subunit synthesis
description: Essential NTPase required for small ribosome subunit synthesis; mediates processing of the 20S pre-rRNA at site D in the cytoplasm but associates only transiently with 43S preribosomes via Rps14p; complex with Rps14 is conserved between humans, yeast, and arches; may be the endonuclease for site D; depletion leads to accumulation of pre-40S ribosomes in 80S-like ribosomes; human TAF9 functionally complements the lethality of the null mutation
functionSummary: NTPase that participates in maturation of SSU-ribosomal RNA (rRNA) from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA); involved in response to oxidative stress; localizes to nucleus and cytoplasmic stress granules
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; overexpression increases resistance to arsenite

briefDescription: Essential nuclear envelope/ER integral membrane protein
description: Essential nuclear envelope/ER integral membrane protein; interacts and functions with Apq12p and Brr6p in lipid homeostasis; mutants are defective in nuclear pore complex biogenesis, mRNA nuclear export and are sensitive to sterol biosynthesis inhibitors and membrane fluidizing agents; identified as a dosage suppressor of a temperature sensitive mutation in the major karyopherin, CRM1; homologous to Brr6p
functionSummary: Integral membrane protein of the nuclear envelope and ER; involved in lipid homeostasis; role in nuclear export of mRNA and protein, and nuclear envelope organization
