description: Subunit of GID Complex, binds strongly to central component Vid30p; GID Complex is involved in proteasome-dependent catabolite inactivation of fructose-1,6-bisphosphatase; recruits Rmd5p, Fyv10 and Vid28p to GID Complex; contains LisH, CTLH, and CRA domains that mediate binding to Vid30p (LisH) and Rmd5p and Vid28p (CTLH and CRA); dosage-dependent regulator of START

briefDescription: Subunit of GID Complex that binds directly to central component Vid30p
description: Subunit of GID Complex that binds directly to central component Vid30p; GID complex is involved in proteasome-dependent catabolite inactivation of fructose-1,6-bisphosphatase; Gid7p contains six WD40 repeats; computational analysis suggests that Gid7p and Moh1p have similar functions

Subunit of Golgi mannosyltransferase complex; this complex mediates elongation of the polysaccharide mannan backbone; forms a separate complex with Van1p that is also involved in backbone elongation; this complex also contains Anp1p, Mnn10p, Mnn11p, and Hoc1p

briefDescription: Subunit of GPI-GlcNAc transferase involved in synthesis of GlcNAc-PI
description: Subunit of GPI-GlcNAc transferase involved in synthesis of GlcNAc-PI; N-acetylglucosaminyl phosphatidylinositol (GlcNAc-PI) is the first intermediate in glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) anchor synthesis; shares similarity with mammalian PIG-P
functionSummary: UDP-glycosyltransferase subunit of glycosylphosphatidylinositol-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase (GPI-GnT) complex; involved in GPI anchor biosynthesis; integral component of endoplasmic reticulum membrane, also localizes to nuclear envelope

briefDescription: Subunit of heterodimeric nuclear SUMO activating enzyme E1 with Aos1p
description: Subunit of heterodimeric nuclear SUMO activating enzyme E1 with Aos1p; activates Smt3p (SUMO) before its conjugation to proteins (sumoylation), which may play a role in protein targeting; essential for viability
functionSummary: Subunit of a SUMO activating enzyme (E1); contributes to the formation of a high energy thioester bond with ubiquitin-like protein SUMO, the first step in protein sumoylation; localizes to the nucleus

briefDescription: Subunit of heterodimeric nuclear SUMO activating enzyme E1 with Uba2p
description: Subunit of heterodimeric nuclear SUMO activating enzyme E1 with Uba2p; activates Smt3p (SUMO) before its conjugation to proteins (sumoylation), which may play a role in protein targeting; essential for viability; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia
functionSummary: Subunit of a SUMO activating enzyme (E1); contributes to the formation of a high energy thioester bond with ubiquitin-like protein SUMO, the first step in protein sumoylation; localizes to the nucleus and relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; repression leads to opi- phenotype (overproduction and excretion of inositol in the absence of inositol and choline)

briefDescription: Subunit of heterodimeric peroxisomal ABC transport complex, with Pxa1p
description: Subunit of heterodimeric peroxisomal ABC transport complex, with Pxa1p; required for import of long-chain fatty acids into peroxisomes; similar to human adrenoleukodystrophy transportesr ABCD1 and ABCD2, and ALD-related proteins; mutations in ABCD1 cause X-linked adrenoleukodystrophy (X-ALD), a peroxisomal disorder; human ABCD1 and ABCD2 can each partially complement yeast pxa1 pxa2 double null mutant
functionSummary: ATPase integral to peroxisomal membrane that catalyzes transmembrane movement of long-chain fatty acids
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows lowered ability to utilize oleic acid as a carbon source

briefDescription: Subunit of heterodimeric peroxisomal ABC transport complex, with Pxa2p
description: Subunit of heterodimeric peroxisomal ABC transport complex, with Pxa2p; required for import of long-chain fatty acids into peroxisomes; similar to human adrenoleukodystrophy transporters ABCD1and ABCD2, and ALD-related proteins; mutations in ABCD1 cause X-linked adrenoleukodystrophy (X-ALD), a peroxisomal disorder; human ABCD1 and ABCD2 can each partially complement yeast pxa1 pxa2 double null mutant
functionSummary: ATPase integral to peroxisomal membrane that catalyzes transmembrane movement of long-chain fatty acids
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows lowered ability to utilize oleic acid as a carbon source and glutamine as a nitrogen source

description: Subunit of heterohexameric prefoldin; prefoldin binds cytosolic chaperonin and transfers target proteins to it; involved in the biogenesis of actin and of alpha- and gamma-tubulin; prefoldin complex also localizes to chromatin of actively transcribed genes in the nucleus and facilitates transcriptional elongation
functionSummary: Chaperone involved in protein folding, cytoskeleton organization, and upregulation of transcription; subunit of prefoldin complex

briefDescription: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C)
description: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C); RF-C is a DNA binding protein and ATPase that acts as a clamp loader of the proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) processivity factor for DNA polymerases delta and epsilon
functionSummary: Component of the DNA replication factor C complex that contributes to DNA clamp loader activity; involved in sister chromatid cohesion and leading strand elongation

briefDescription: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C)
description: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C); RF-C is a DNA binding protein and ATPase that acts as a clamp loader of the proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) processivity factor for DNA polymerases delta and epsilon
functionSummary: Subunit of the DNA replication factor C complex that is contributes to DNA clamp loading; involved in DNA mismatch repair and leading DNA strand elongation

briefDescription: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C)
description: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C); RF-C is a DNA binding protein and ATPase that acts as a clamp loader of the proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) processivity factor for DNA polymerases delta and epsilon

briefDescription: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C)
description: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C); which is a DNA binding protein and ATPase that acts as a clamp loader of the proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) processivity factor for DNA polymerases delta and epsilon; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia
functionSummary: ATPase that contributes to DNA clamp loading; involved in leading strand elongation, mismatch repair, sister chromatid cohesion; localizes to nucleus, cytosol, is subunit of Rad17 RFC-like, Ctf18 RFC-like, Elg1 RFC-like and DNA replication factor C complexes
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; heterozygous null mutation in diploid causes starvation sensitivity; reduction of function results in decreased competitive fitness

briefDescription: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C)
description: Subunit of heteropentameric Replication factor C (RF-C); which is a DNA binding protein and ATPase that acts as a clamp loader of the proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) processivity factor for DNA polymerases delta and epsilon; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

briefDescription: Subunit of heterotrimeric Replication Protein A (RPA)
description: Subunit of heterotrimeric Replication Protein A (RPA); RPA is a highly conserved single-stranded DNA binding protein complex involved in DNA replication, repair, recombination; RPA protects against inappropriate telomere recombination, and upon telomere uncapping, prevents cell proliferation by a checkpoint-independent pathway; with Sgs1p-Top2p-Rmi1p, stimulates DNA catenation/decatenation activity of Top3p; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; null mutant displays abnormal cellular morphology and increased mutation frequency

briefDescription: Subunit of heterotrimeric Replication Protein A (RPA)
description: Subunit of heterotrimeric Replication Protein A (RPA); RPA is a highly conserved single-stranded DNA binding protein involved in DNA replication, repair, and recombination; RPA protects against inappropriate telomere recombination, and upon telomere uncapping, prevents cell proliferation by a checkpoint-independent pathway; in concert with Sgs1p-Top2p-Rmi1p, stimulates DNA catenation/decatenation activity of Top3p; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication s
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; null mutant has decreased resistance to heat, UV, and DNA-damaging agents; abnormal cellular morphology, cell cycle progression, and shortened telomeres

briefDescription: Subunit of heterotrimeric Replication Protein A (RPA)
description: Subunit of heterotrimeric Replication Protein A (RPA); RPA is a highly conserved single-stranded DNA binding protein involved in DNA replication, repair, and recombination; RPA protects against inappropriate telomere recombination, and upon telomere uncapping, prevents cell proliferation by a checkpoint-independent pathway; role in DNA catenation/decatenation pathway of chromosome disentangling; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia
functionSummary: A DNA-binding protein involved in DNA replication, repair and recombination as well as maintenance of telomeres; localizes to condensed nuclear chromosome as well as telomeric regions of chromsomes
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; null mutant has decreased resistance to heat, UV, and DNA-damaging agents; abnormal spindle morphology/positioning, cell cycle progression, chromosome segregation and budding

briefDescription: Subunit of hexameric RecA-like ATPase Elp456 Elongator subcomplex
description: Subunit of hexameric RecA-like ATPase Elp456 Elongator subcomplex; which is required for modification of wobble nucleosides in tRNA; iki1 mutations confer resistance to the K. lactis toxin zymocin

briefDescription: Subunit of hexameric RecA-like ATPase Elp456 Elongator subcomplex
description: Subunit of hexameric RecA-like ATPase Elp456 Elongator subcomplex; which is required for modification of wobble nucleosides in tRNA; required for Elongator structural integrity

briefDescription: Subunit of hexameric RecA-like ATPase Elp456 Elongator subcomplex
description: Subunit of hexameric RecA-like ATPase Elp456 Elongator subcomplex; which is required for modification of wobble nucleosides in tRNA; required for Elongator structural integrity; null mutation is functionally complemented by human ELP4
functionSummary: Subunit of Elongator holoenzyme complex; contributes to transfer RNA (tRNA) binding and ATPase activity; involved in transfer RNA (tRNA) wobble uridine modification and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II; localized to nucleus and cytoplasm
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to paraquat and MMS, but resistant to tunicamycin; also shows decreased thermotolerance, increased heat sensitivity, defects in endocytosis and biofilm formation; in competitive growth studies null mutant shows decreased fitness

briefDescription: Subunit of HIR nucleosome assembly complex
description: Subunit of HIR nucleosome assembly complex; involved in regulation of histone gene transcription; recruits Swi-Snf complexes to histone gene promoters; promotes heterochromatic gene silencing with Asf1p; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia
functionSummary: Transcriptional corepressor that is part of the HIR complex; negatively regulates transcription of HTA1 and HTB1; localized to the nucleus and cytosol

description: Subunit of holo-CPF; holo-CPF is a multiprotein complex and functional homolog of mammalian CPSF, required for the cleavage and polyadenylation of mRNA and snoRNA 3' ends; involved in pre-tRNA processing; binds to the phosphorylated CTD of RNAPII

briefDescription: Subunit of inner ring of nuclear pore complex (NPC)
description: Subunit of inner ring of nuclear pore complex (NPC); contributes to NPC assembly and nucleocytoplasmic transport; interacts with genomic regions that contain ribosomal protein and subtelomeric genes, where it functions in nucleosome positioning and as a repressor of transcription; both Nup170p and Nup157p are similar to human Nup155p; NUP170 has a paralog, NUP157, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Component of the inner ring of the Nuclear Pore Complex (NPC), which is involved in nucleocytoplasmic transport and assembly of the NPC; also has roles in chromosome segregation, nucleosome positioning and chromatin silencing, tethering of telomeres to nuclear periphery, and the mitotic spindle assemble checkpoint; binds the RSC chromatin remodeling complex

briefDescription: Subunit of ISW2/yCHRAC chromatin accessibility complex
description: Subunit of ISW2/yCHRAC chromatin accessibility complex; ISW2/yCHRAC also includes Itc1p, Isw2p, and Dpb4p; involved in inheritance of telomeric silencing; DLS1 has a paralog, DPB3, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Nuclear protein involved in telomeric silencing; subunit of CHRAC chromatin accessibility complex that regulates RNA polymerase II transcription, DNA replication, and DNA repair
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows elevated silencing at telomeres; in systematic studies mutants show defects in endocytosis and also exhibit increased competitive fitness in rich media and reduced competitive fitness in glycerol media

briefDescription: Subunit of mitochondrial NAD(+)-dependent isocitrate dehydrogenase
description: Subunit of mitochondrial NAD(+)-dependent isocitrate dehydrogenase; complex catalyzes the oxidation of isocitrate to alpha-ketoglutarate in the TCA cycle
functionSummary: Subunit of the mitochondrial NAD(+)-dependent isocitrate dehydrogenase complex, which catalyzes the oxidative decarboxylation of isocitrate to form 2-oxoglutarate; involved in glutamate biosynthesis and the tricarboxylic acid cycle; localizes to the mitochondrial matrix and nucleoid

briefDescription: Subunit of mitochondrial NAD(+)-dependent isocitrate dehydrogenase
description: Subunit of mitochondrial NAD(+)-dependent isocitrate dehydrogenase; complex catalyzes the oxidation of isocitrate to alpha-ketoglutarate in the TCA cycle; phosphorylated

briefDescription: Subunit of MRX complex with Mre11p and Xrs2p
description: Subunit of MRX complex with Mre11p and Xrs2p; complex is involved in processing double-strand DNA breaks in vegetative cells, initiation of meiotic DSBs, telomere maintenance, and nonhomologous end joining; forms nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress
functionSummary: Adenylate kinase and ATPase, component of the nuclear Mre11 complex that is involved in double-stranded break repair, telomere maintenance and initiating DSBs in meiosis
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is sensitive to DNA damaging agents, DNA synthesis and topoisomerase inhibitors; null mutant is sensitive to X-rays, gamma rays and UV radiation; null displays increased chromosome instability, increased loss-of-heterozygosity in diploids, an increased mutation rate and elevated Ty element transposition; null mutant has increased cell size, a decreased growth rate and decreased competitive fitness on rich and synthetic media; diploid null displays decreased sporulation and haploid has decreased spore germination; null is temperature sensitive, sensitive to oxidative stress, has decreased replicative lifespan and decreased telomere length

briefDescription: Subunit of NuA4, an essential histone acetyltransferase complex
description: Subunit of NuA4, an essential histone acetyltransferase complex; positions Piccolo NuA4 for efficient acetylation of histone H4 or histone H2A; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia; similar to human tumor suppressor ING1 and its isoforms ING4 and ING5
functionSummary: Methylated histone-binding subunit of the NuA4 histone acetyltransferase complex involved in DNA repair and chromatin modification
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutants are sensitive to acidic pH, TOR inhibitor rapamycin, DNA-damaging agent methyl methanesulfonate (MMS), microtubule-destabilising agent benomyl, and Calcofluor White

briefDescription: Subunit of NuA4, an essential histone H4/H2A acetyltransferase complex
description: Subunit of NuA4, an essential histone H4/H2A acetyltransferase complex; conserved region at N-terminus is essential for interaction with the NPC (nucleosome core particle); required for autophagy; homologous to Drosophila Enhancer of Polycomb; coding sequence contains length polymorphisms in different strains

briefDescription: Subunit of NuA4 histone H4 acetyltransferase and SWR1 complexes
description: Subunit of NuA4 histone H4 acetyltransferase and SWR1 complexes; may function to antagonize silencing near telomeres; interacts directly with Swc4p; has homology to human leukemogenic protein AF9; contains a YEATS domain

Subunit of nuclear RNase P; nuclear RNase P cleaves tRNA precursors to generate mature 5' ends and facilitates turnover of nuclear RNAs; not shared between RNase MRP and RNase P, in contrast to all other RNase P protein subunits; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

briefDescription: Subunit of Nup84p subcomplex of nuclear pore complex (NPC)
description: Subunit of Nup84p subcomplex of nuclear pore complex (NPC); contributes to nucleocytoplasmic transport, NPC biogenesis; is involved in establishment of a normal nucleocytoplasmic concentration gradient of GTPase Gsp1p; also plays roles in several processes that may require localization of genes or chromosomes at nuclear periphery, including double-strand break repair, transcription and chromatin silencing; relocalizes to cytosol in response to hypoxia; homolog of human NUP133

briefDescription: Subunit of phosphatidylinositol (PtdIns) 3-kinase complexes I and II
description: Subunit of phosphatidylinositol (PtdIns) 3-kinase complexes I and II; Complex I is essential in autophagy, Complex II is required for vacuolar protein sorting; required for overflow degradation of misfolded proteins when ERAD is saturated; C-terminus has novel globular fold essential for autophagy through the targeting of the PI3-kinase complex I to the pre-autophagosomal structure; ortholog of higher eukaryote gene Beclin 1; human BECN1 can complement yeast null mutant
functionSummary: Subunit of different phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase complexes involved in either autophagy or vacuolar protein sorting via endosomes; localizes to membranes; involved in endosome to Golgi retrograde transport, late endosome to vacuole transport, the CVT pathway, phosphatidylinositol biosynthesis, and various types of autophagy
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant fails to undergo autophagy or mitophagy and displays mitochondrial genome instability; null mutant is sensitive to Cd2+ but resistant to Ni2+ and Zn2+; null mutant displays protein mislocalization suggesting a defect in endosome-to-Golgi retrograde transport; null mutant has slower respiratory growth, fails to sporulate, and is sensitive to tunicamycin; in large-scale studies, the null mutant shows increased competitive fitness in synthetic complete medium but decreased competitive fitness in several other media; null mutant has shorter chronological lifespan, sensitivity to heat and desiccation, and altered resistance to a variety of chemicals

briefDescription: Subunit of PPCDC and CoA-SPC complexes involved in CoA biosynthesis
description: Subunit of PPCDC and CoA-SPC complexes involved in CoA biosynthesis; subunits of the phosphopantothenoylcysteine decarboxylase (PPCDC) complex are: Cab3p, Sis2p, Vhs3p, while the subunits of the CoA-synthesizing protein complex (CoA-SPC) are: Cab2p, Cab3p, Cab4p, and Cab5p as well as Sis2p and Vhs3p; null mutant lethality is complemented by E. coli coaBC
functionSummary: Phosphopantothenoylcysteine decarboxylase involved in coenzyme A biosynthesis; component of CoA-synthesizing and phosphopantothenoylcysteine decarboxylase complexes
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional mutant has increased resistance to killer toxin at elevated temperature; conditional mutant displays a reduction in DNA-damaging agent induced up-regulation of Rnr3p; overexpression results in decrease resistance to ionic stress in lithium chloride treated cells

briefDescription: Subunit of protein N-terminal acetyltransferase NatA
description: Subunit of protein N-terminal acetyltransferase NatA; NatA comprised of Nat1p, Ard1p, and Nat5p; N-terminally acetylates many proteins to influence multiple processes such as cell cycle progression, heat-shock resistance, mating, sporulation, telomeric silencing and early stages of mitophagy; orthologous to human NAA15; expression of both human NAA10 and NAA15 functionally complements ard1 nat1 double mutant although single mutations are not complemented by their orthologs
functionSummary: Protein alpha-N-acetyltransferase subunit of NatA complex involved in N-terminal protein amino acid acetylation; localizes to cytosolic ribosomes
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is defective in protein N-terminal acetylation and shows increased heat sensitivity, decreased mating efficiency, reduced mitophagy and respiratory growth rate, lower survival in stationary phase, and decreased competitive fitness; overexpression causes increased chromosome instability

briefDescription: Subunit of protein N-terminal acetyltransferase NatA
description: Subunit of protein N-terminal acetyltransferase NatA; NatA comprises Nat1p, Ard1p, Nat5p; acetylates many proteins to influence telomeric silencing, cell cycle, heat-shock resistance, mating, sporulation, early stages of mitophagy; protein abundance increases under DNA replication stress; mutations in human homolog X-linked NAA10 lead to Ogden syndrome (S37P) and intellectual disability (R116W); expression of human NAA10 and NAA15 can complement ard1 nat1 double mutant
functionSummary: Subunit of protein N-terminal acetyltransferase (NatA) complex; contributes to the transfer of acetyl groups to N-terminal Ser, Ala, Gly, or Thr residues of proteins; NatA complex colocolizes with cytosolic ribosomes
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays decreased pheromone sensitivity, reduced mating efficiency and sporulation, decreased respiratory growth; increased heat sensitivity and decreased innate thermotolerance; null mutation also decreases survival rate in stationary phase

briefDescription: Subunit of protein N-terminal acetyltransferase NatA
description: Subunit of protein N-terminal acetyltransferase NatA; NatA is comprised of Nat1p, Ard1p, and Nat5p; N-terminally acetylates many proteins, which influences multiple processes such as the cell cycle, heat-shock resistance, mating, sporulation, and telomeric silencing
functionSummary: Subunit of acetyltransferase NatA complex involved in N-terminal protein acetylation; localizes in cytoplasm

briefDescription: Subunit of protein phosphatase PP4 complex
description: Subunit of protein phosphatase PP4 complex; Pph3p and Psy2p form the active complex, Psy4p may provide additional substrate specificity; regulates recovery from the DNA damage checkpoint, the gene conversion- and single-strand annealing-mediated pathways of meiotic double-strand break repair and efficient Non-Homologous End-Joining (NHEJ) pathway; Pph3p and Psy2p localize to foci on meiotic chromosomes; putative homolog of mammalian R3

briefDescription: Subunit of RAVE complex (Rav1p, Rav2p, Skp1p)
description: Subunit of RAVE complex (Rav1p, Rav2p, Skp1p); the RAVE complex associates with the V1 domain of the vacuolar membrane (H+)-ATPase (V-ATPase) and promotes assembly and reassembly of the holoenzyme

briefDescription: Subunit of RAVE complex (Rav1p, Rav2p, Skp1p)
description: Subunit of RAVE complex (Rav1p, Rav2p, Skp1p); the RAVE complex promotes assembly of the V-ATPase holoenzyme; required for transport between the early and late endosome/PVC and for localization of TGN membrane proteins; potential Cdc28p substrate

briefDescription: Subunit of ribosome-associated quality control trigger complex (RQT)
description: Subunit of ribosome-associated quality control trigger complex (RQT); has a CUE domain that binds ubiquitin, which may facilitate intramolecular monoubiquitination
functionSummary: Ubiquitin binding protein whose localization is unknown
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; in systematic studies mutants display reduced chronological lifespan, increased sensitivity to elevated temperatures and increased sensitivity to paromomycin, cycloheximide and MMS, but increased resistance to miconazole

briefDescription: Subunit of ribosome-associated quality control trigger complex (RQT)
description: Subunit of ribosome-associated quality control trigger complex (RQT); the authentic, non-tagged protein is detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies
functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the cytoplasm and mitochondrion in large-scale studies

briefDescription: Subunit of RNAPII-associated chromatin remodeling Paf1 complex
description: Subunit of RNAPII-associated chromatin remodeling Paf1 complex; regulates gene expression by directing cotranscriptional histone modification, influences transcription and chromatin structure through several independent functional domains; directly or indirectly regulates DNA-binding properties of Spt15p and relative activities of different TATA elements; involved in transcription elongation as demonstrated by the G-less-based run-on (GLRO) assay
functionSummary: Non-DNA binding transcription factor; subunit of the CDc73/Paf1 transcription elongation complex; involved in regulation of transcription from RNA Pol I and II promoters, snoRNA 3'-end processing, regulation of histone H2B ubiquitination and H3 methylation and other cellular processes

briefDescription: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex
description: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex; one of six subunits of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex (TFIIIC); part of TFIIIC TauB domain that binds BoxB promoter sites of tRNA and other genes; cooperates with Tfc3p in DNA binding; human homolog is TFIIIC-110
functionSummary: Subunit of the transcription factor TFIIIC complex; involved in recruiting TFIIIB to chromatin for transcription of RNA genes by RNA polymerase III

briefDescription: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex
description: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex; one of six subunits of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex (TFIIIC); part of TFIIIC TauB domain that binds BoxB promoter sites of tRNA and other genes; linker between TauB and TauA domains; human homolog is TFIIIC-90
functionSummary: Subunit of the transcription factor TFIIIC complex; involved in recruiting TFIIIB to chromatin for transcription of RNA genes by RNA polymerase III

briefDescription: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex
description: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex; one of six subunits of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex (TFIIIC); part of the TauA domain of TFIIIC that binds BoxA DNA promoter sites of tRNA and similar genes; has TPR motifs; human homolog is TFIIIC-102
functionSummary: Subunit of the transcription factor TFIIIC complex; involved in recruiting TFIIIB to chromatin for transcription of RNA genes by RNA polymerase III

briefDescription: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex
description: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex; one of six subunits of the RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex (TFIIIC); part of the TauA globular domain of TFIIIC that binds DNA at the BoxA promoter sites of tRNA and similar genes; human homolog is TFIIIC-63
functionSummary: Subunit of the transcription factor TFIIIC complex; involved in recruiting TFIIIB to chromatin for transcription of RNA genes by RNA polymerase III

briefDescription: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex
description: Subunit of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex; part of TauB domain of TFIIIC that binds DNA at BoxB promoter sites of tRNA and similar genes; cooperates with Tfc6p in DNA binding; largest of six subunits of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation factor complex (TFIIIC); colocalizes with condensin at pol III genes and several ETC (“extra TFIIIC)” sites; may have a role in recruiting or stabilizing Scc2/4 and condensin on chromosomes
functionSummary: Subunit of the transcription factor TFIIIC complex; involved in recruiting TFIIIB to chromatin for transcription of RNA genes by RNA polymerase III
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional mutants display abnormal protein distribution of condensin complex subunit proteins, Brn1p and Scc4p resulting in decreased association of these proteins with chromosomes; heterozygous null mutant shows a decreased rate of growth

description: Subunit of RNase MRP; RNase MRP processes pre-rRNA and has a role in cell cycle-regulated degradation of daughter cell-specific mRNAs; unlike most subunits, not shared between RNase MRP and nuclear RNase P

briefDescription: Subunit of RNase MRP, nuclear RNase P and telomerase
description: Subunit of RNase MRP, nuclear RNase P and telomerase; forms a soluble heterodimer with Pop6p that binds P3 domain of RNase MRP and RNase P RNAs; RNase MRP cleaves pre-rRNA, nuclear RNase P cleaves tRNA precursors to generate mature 5' ends and facilitates turnover of nuclear RNAs, while telomerase replenishes telomeric DNA

briefDescription: Subunit of RNase MRP, nuclear RNase P and telomerase
description: Subunit of RNase MRP, nuclear RNase P and telomerase; forms a soluble heterodimer with Pop7p that binds P3 domain of RNase MRP and RNase P RNAs; RNase MRP cleaves pre-rRNA, nuclear RNase P cleaves tRNA precursors to generate mature 5' ends and facilitates turnover of nuclear RNAs, while telomerase replenishes telomeric DNA; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

briefDescription: Subunit of RNase MRP, nuclear RNase P and telomerase complexes
description: Subunit of RNase MRP, nuclear RNase P and telomerase complexes; RNase MRP cleaves pre-rRNA, nuclear RNase P cleaves tRNA precursors to generate mature 5' ends and facilitates turnover of nuclear RNAs, while telomerase replenishes telomeric DNA; binds to the RPR1 RNA subunit in RNase P

briefDescription: Subunit of SAGA and NuA4 histone acetyltransferase complexes
description: Subunit of SAGA and NuA4 histone acetyltransferase complexes; interacts with acidic activators (e.g., Gal4p) which leads to transcription activation; similar to human TRRAP, which is a cofactor for c-Myc mediated oncogenic transformation
functionSummary: Component of SAGA, SLIK, NuA4 histone acetyltransferase complexes; involved in positive regulation of RNA polymerase II transcription; targets DNA-bound activators for recruitment to promoters
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; mutations cause inositol auxotrophy, lower respiratory growth rate, sensitivity to temperature, benomyl, Calcofluor White, tunicamycin, rapamycin, tert-butyl hydroperoxide and chloramphenicol

briefDescription: Subunit of SEACAT, a subcomplex of the SEA complex
description: Subunit of SEACAT, a subcomplex of the SEA complex; Mtc1p, along with Rtc1p and Sea4p, redundantly inhibit the TORC1 inhibitory role of the Iml1p/SEACIT (Iml1p-Npr2p-Npr3p) subcomplex, a GAP for GTPase Gtr1p (EGOC subunit) in response to amino acid limitation, thereby resulting in activation of TORC1 signaling; SEA is a coatomer-related complex that associates dynamically with the vacuole; relative distribution to the vacuolar membrane decreases upon DNA replication stress
functionSummary: Subunit of Seh1-associated complex that regulates TOR signaling; localizes to vacuole membrane

briefDescription: Subunit of SEACAT, a subcomplex of the SEA complex
description: Subunit of SEACAT, a subcomplex of the SEA complex; Rtc1p, along with Mtc5p and Sea4p, redundantly inhibit the TORC1 inhibitory role of the Iml1p/SEACIT (Iml1p-Npr2p-Npr3p) subcomplex, a GAP for GTPase Gtr1p (EGOC subunit) in response to amino acid limitation, thereby resulting in activation of TORC1 signaling; SEA is a coatomer-related complex that associates dynamically with the vacuole; has N-terminal WD-40 repeats and a C-terminal RING motif; null suppresses cdc13-1
functionSummary: Component of the Seh1-associated complex that associates with the vacuolar membrane; involved in positive regulation of TOR signaling; also found to colocalize with the ribosome in a large scale study

briefDescription: Subunit of SEACAT, a subcomplex of the SEA complex
description: Subunit of SEACAT, a subcomplex of the SEA complex; Sea4p, along with Rtc1p and Mtc5p, redundantly inhibit the TORC1 inhibitory role of the Iml1p/SEACIT (Iml1p-Npr2p-Npr3p) subcomplex, a GAP for GTPase Gtr1p (EGOC subunit) in response to amino acid limitation, thereby resulting in activation of TORC1 signaling; SEA is a coatomer-related complex that associates dynamically with the vacuole; contains an N-terminal beta-propeller fold and a C-terminal RING motif
functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; component of the Seh1-associated complex; also localizes to the vacuolar membrane

description: Subunit of signal peptidase complex; complex catalyzes cleavage of N-terminal signal sequences of proteins targeted to the secretory pathway; homologous to mammalian SPC22/23; other members of the complex are Spc1p, Spc2p, and Sec11p

Subunit of signal peptidase complex; complex catalyzes cleavage of N-terminal signal sequences of proteins targeted to the secretory pathway; homologous to mammalian SPC25; other members of the complex are Spc1p, Spc1p, and Sec11p
functionSummary: Peptidase involved in signal peptide processing and protein targeting to endoplasmic reticulum; subunit of signal peptidase complex

briefDescription: Subunit of Slx5-Slx8 SUMO-targeted ubiquitin ligase (STUbL) complex
description: Subunit of Slx5-Slx8 SUMO-targeted ubiquitin ligase (STUbL) complex; role in proteolysis of spindle positioning protein Kar9, DNA repair proteins Rad52p and Rad57p; stimulated by SUMO-modified substrates; contains a C-terminal RING domain; forms nuclear foci upon DNA replication stress; required for maintenance of genome integrity like human ortholog RNF
functionSummary: Subunit of the Slx5-Slx8 SUMO-targeted ubiquitin ligase (STUbL) complex; contributes to the ubiquitin ligase activity of the complex; involved in the cellular response to DNA damage and telomere maintenance; localizes to the nucleus with a sub-pool at the centromere
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant has a reduced growth rate and competitive fitness; null mutant displays elevated whole chromosome aneuploidy, increased gross chromosomal rearrangements and loss of heterozygosity; null mutant has a metaphase delay, and decreased duration of the G1 phase; null mutant displays spindle defects including: mispositioned spindles, fish hook spindles, and aberrant spindle kinetics; null mutant has abnormal nuclear morphology with some nuclear extensions at the nuclear envelope adjacent to the nucleolus in large-budded cells; null has decreased resistance to DNA synthesis inhibitors, DNA damaging agents and UV radiation; homozygous diploid null has a sporulation defect; overexpression results in inviability

briefDescription: Subunit of Snt2C complex, RING finger ubiquitin ligase (E3)
description: Subunit of Snt2C complex, RING finger ubiquitin ligase (E3); physically associates with Ecm5p and Rpd3p; along with Ecm5p, recruits Rpd3p to small number of promoters; colocalizes with Ecm5p, independently of Rpd3p, to promoters of stress response genes upon oxidative stress; involved in ubiquitination, degradation of excess histones; interacts with Ubc4p; role in regulating genes encoding amine transporters; relocalizes from nucleus to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress

Subunit of spindle-assembly checkpoint complex; involved in delaying anaphase onset in cells with defects in mitotic spindle assembly; pseudosubstrate inhibitor of APC(Cdc20), the anaphase promoting complex involved in securin (Pds1p) turnover; MAD3 has a paralog, BUB1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: A subunit of the mitotic checkpoint complex involved in  mitotic spindle assembly checkpoint and distributive segregation

description: Subunit of structure-specific Mms4p-Mus81p endonuclease; cleaves branched DNA; involved in DNA repair, replication fork stability, and joint molecule formation/resolution during meiotic recombination; promotes template switching during break-induced replication (BIR), causing non-reciprocal translocations (NRTs); helix-hairpin-helix protein; phosphorylation of non-catalytic subunit Mms4p by Cdc28p and Cdcp during mitotic cell cycle activates function of Mms4p-Mus81p

Subunit of structure-specific Mms4p-Mus81p endonuclease; cleaves branched DNA; involved in recombination, DNA repair, and joint molecule formation/resolution during meiotic recombination; phosphorylation of the non-catalytic subunit Mms4p by Cdc28p and Cdc5p during mitotic cell cycle activates the function of Mms4p-Mus81p
functionSummary: Subunit of Holliday junction resolvase complex that contributes to crossover junction endodeoxyribonuclease activity; involved in cellular response to DNA damage stimulus, reciprocal meiotic recombination, DNA toplogical changes and repair

briefDescription: Subunit of succinate dehydrogenase and of TIM22 translocase
description: Subunit of succinate dehydrogenase and of TIM22 translocase; functions as cytochrome b subunit of succinate dehydrogenase, which couples oxidation of succinate to transfer of electrons to ubiquinone as part of the TCA cycle and the mitochondrial respiratory chain; also required for mitochondrial inner membrane protein import as part of the TIM22 complex; SDH3 has a paralog, SHH3, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Subunit of the succinate dehydrogenase mitochondrial respiratory chain complex, and also of the TIM22 mitochondrial inner membrane protein insertion complex; required for cellular respiration

description: Subunit of telomeric Ku complex (Yku70p-Yku80p); involved in telomere length maintenance, structure and telomere position effect; required for localization of telomerase ribonucleoprotein via interaction with TLC1 guide RNA; relocates to sites of double-strand cleavage to promote nonhomologous end joining during DSB repair; colocalizes with quiescent cell telomere hyperclusters

briefDescription: Subunit of TFIID, TFIIF, INO80, SWI/SNF, and NuA3 complexes
description: Subunit of TFIID, TFIIF, INO80, SWI/SNF, and NuA3 complexes; involved in RNA polymerase II transcription initiation and in chromatin modification; contains a YEATS domain

briefDescription: Subunit of TFIIH and nucleotide excision repair factor 3 complexes
description: Subunit of TFIIH and nucleotide excision repair factor 3 complexes; involved in transcription initiation, required for nucleotide excision repair; ring finger protein similar to mammalian CAK and TFIIH subunit
functionSummary: Subunit of holo TFIIH and TFIIK complexes involved in core RNA polymerase binding transcription factor activity; contributes to phosphorylation of RNA polymerase II C-terminal domain, nucleotide-excision repair, and transcription by RNA polymerase II
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; tfb3-ts mutant displays sensitivity to caffeine at the permissive temperature and sensitivity to UV light at the semi-permissive temperature; in large-scale studies, repression confers increased chromosomal rearrangement and loss; diploid heterozygous null mutant has lowered innate thermotolerance and is haploinsufficient

briefDescription: Subunit of TFIIH and nucleotide excision repair factor 3 complexes
description: Subunit of TFIIH and nucleotide excision repair factor 3 complexes; involved in transcription initiation, required for nucleotide excision repair, similar to 52 kDa subunit of human TFIIH

briefDescription: Subunit of TFIIH and nucleotide excision repair factor 3 complexes
description: Subunit of TFIIH and nucleotide excision repair factor 3 complexes; required for nucleotide excision repair, target for transcriptional activators; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

Subunit of TFIIH complex; facilities dissociation of the Ssl2p helices from TFIIH; expression levels regulated by Arg5,6p; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm and nucleus
functionSummary: Nuclear protein that is part of the holo TFIIH complex; biological role is unknown

description: Subunit of TFIIH complex; involved in transcription initiation, similar to 34 kDa subunit of human TFIIH; interacts with Ssl1p

briefDescription: Subunit of the 19S regulatory particle of the 26S proteasome lid
description: Subunit of the 19S regulatory particle of the 26S proteasome lid; acts as a ubiquitin receptor for the proteasome; null mutants accumulate ubiquitinated Gcn4p and display decreased 26S proteasome stability; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress

briefDescription: Subunit of the 19S regulatory particle of the 26S proteasome lid
description: Subunit of the 19S regulatory particle of the 26S proteasome lid; synthetically lethal with RPT1, which is an ATPase component of the 19S regulatory particle; physically interacts with Nob1p and Rpn3p; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
Subunit of the 26S proteasome; substrate of the N-acetyltransferase Nat1p; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress
functionSummary: Protein-protein adaptor subunit of proteasome regulatory particle, base subcomplex; involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein degradation and proteasome assembly; localizes to nucleus and proteasome storage granules
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; reduction of function causes senstitvity to MMS and decreased competitive fitness

briefDescription: Subunit of the Ada histone acetyltransferase complex
description: Subunit of the Ada histone acetyltransferase complex; required for structural integrity of the complex; Ahc2p and Ahc1p are unique to the ADA complex and not shared with the related SAGA and SLIK complexes; Ahc2p may tether Ahc1p to the complex
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; homozygous diploid null mutant has an elevated level of homologous recombination and increased formation of spontaneous Rad52p loci; null mutant has increased chronological lifespan, and displays a reduction in apoptosis after a ramped heat stimulus; null mutant has a decreased rate of proline utilization; null mutant displays decreased localization of Boi2 to the bud neck, indicative of a requirement for NoCut function in cells with an anaphase defect; heterozygous null mutant is haploinsufficient; overexpression results in a decreased rate of vegetative growth

briefDescription: Subunit of the alpha-1,6 mannosyltransferase complex
description: Subunit of the alpha-1,6 mannosyltransferase complex; type II membrane protein; has a role in retention of glycosyltransferases in the Golgi; involved in osmotic sensitivity and resistance to aminonitrophenyl propanediol
functionSummary: A component of alpha-1,6-mannosyltransferase complex involved in protein N-linked glycosylation; located at the Golgi cis cisterna
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is heat sensitive, has a decreased growth rate, decreased competitive fitness on various growth media and decreased ability to utilize various carbon sources; null mutant has abnormally round buds, large cell size, and abnormal lipid particle morphology; null mutant displays decreased resistance to desiccation and freeze thaw, a decreased ability to form biofilms, and reduced chronological lifespan; null mutant has increased chitin deposition, and increased accumulation of sterol esters, triglycerides and glycogen in early stationary phase cells; overexpression results in a decreased growth rate; heterozygous diploid null is haploinsufficient

description: Subunit of the anaphase-promoting complex (APC); APC is an E3 ubiquitin ligase that regulates the metaphase-anaphase transition and exit from mitosis; required for activation of the daughter-specific gene expression and spore wall maturation

Subunit of the anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C); which is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition; required for sporulation; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C); APC/C is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition
functionSummary: Ubiquitin transferase that is a component of the anaphase-promoting complex involved in degradation of mitotic cyclins and transition from metaphase to anaphase during mitotic cell cycle
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation causes delayed passage through metaphase-anaphase transition and accumulation of G2/M cells; null mutant is resistant to bleomycin, caffeine, fenpropimorph, but sensitive to camptothecin and rapamycin

description: Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C); APC/C is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition

Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C); APC/C is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition

Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C); APC/C is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition; component of the platform domain of the APC/C, based on structural analysis; relative distribution to nuclear foci decreases upon DNA replication stress
functionSummary: Ubiquitin transferase that is a component of the anaphase-promoting complex involved in degradation of mitotic cyclins and transition from metaphase to anaphase during mitotic cell cycle
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; reduction-of-function mutations cause cell cycle arrest at G2/M phase transition, increased competitive fitness and shortened chronological and replicative lifespan; some mutations elevate resistance to benomyl and cycloheximide

description: Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C); APC/C is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition; component of the platform domain of the APC/C, based on structural analysis; relative distribution to the nucleus increases upon DNA replication stress
functionSummary: Ubiquitin transferase that is a component of the anaphase-promoting complex involved in degradation of mitotic cyclins and transition from metaphase to anaphase during mitotic cell cycle
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional (ts) mutant shows chromosome instability; reduction of function leads to reduced telomere length and increased competitive fitness

description: Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C); necessary for maintaining sister chromatid cohesion in prophase I of meiosis by inhibiting premature ubiquitination and subsequent degradation of substrates by the APC(Ama1) ubiquitin ligase

Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C); which is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition; component of the catalytic core of the APC/C; has similarity to cullin Cdc53p
functionSummary: Ubiquitin transferase that is a component of the anaphase-promoting complex involved in degradation of mitotic cyclins and transition from metaphase to anaphase during mitotic cell cycle
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; reduction of function decreases competitive fitness; haploproficient but heterozygous diploid is sensitive to starvation

description: Subunit of the Anaphase-Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C); which is a ubiquitin-protein ligase required for degradation of anaphase inhibitors, including mitotic cyclins, during the metaphase/anaphase transition; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia

briefDescription: Subunit of the APT subcomplex of cleavage and polyadenylation factor
description: Subunit of the APT subcomplex of cleavage and polyadenylation factor; may have a role in 3' end formation of both polyadenylated and non-polyadenylated RNAs; SYC1 has a paralog, YSH1, that arose from the whole genome duplication
Subunit of the ARP2/3 complex; ARP2/3 is required for the motility and integrity of cortical actin patches
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant fails to localize actin patches to growing buds, accumulates high amounts of chitin in cell walls, and shows defects in mitochondrial movement; in systematic studies null mutants produce abnormally shaped buds, show decreased endocytosis, increased sensitivity to heat and multiple chemicals, including caffeine, caspofungin, cycloheximide, DMSO, azole drugs, fenpropimorph, MMS

description: Subunit of the ARP2/3 complex; ARP2/3 is required for the motility and integrity of cortical actin patches
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant forms aberrant actin structures, grows very slowly, and produces spores with reduced viability; repression causes abnormal mitochondrial morphology, elevated excretion of inositol and confers resistance to myriocin

description: Subunit of the ARP2/3 complex; ARP2/3 is required for the motility and integrity of cortical actin patches; has mRNA binding activity
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant forms abnormal actin cytoskeleton structures, grows very slowly and produces spores with low viability

description: Subunit of the ARP2/3 complex; ARP2/3 is required for the motility and integrity of cortical actin patches; mutation is functionally complemented by human ARPC4
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant forms aberrant actin structures, grows very slowly, and produces spores with reduced viability

description: Subunit of the ARP2/3 complex; ARP2/3 is required for the motility and integrity of cortical actin patches; required for cortical localization of calmodulin
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant forms aberrant actin structures, grows very slowly, and produces spores with reduced viability; conditional (ts) mutant shows decreased endocytosis and increased sensitivity to hyperosmotic stress; repression causes abnormal mitochondrial morphology and confers resistance to myriocin

briefDescription: Subunit of the ASTRA complex, involved in chromatin remodeling
description: Subunit of the ASTRA complex, involved in chromatin remodeling; subunit of the telomere cap complex DNA-binding protein specific to single-stranded yeast telomeric DNA repeats, required for telomere length regulation and telomere position effect; involved in the stability or biogenesis of PIKKs such as TORC1

briefDescription: Subunit of the ASTRA complex, involved in chromatin remodeling
description: Subunit of the ASTRA complex, involved in chromatin remodeling; telomere length regulator involved in the stability or biogenesis of PIKKs such as TORC1
functionSummary: Protein whose biological role is unknown; localizes to the ASTRA complex in a large-scale study
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional (ts) mutation causes cell cycle arrest at G1 phase upon shift to non-permissive temperature and decreased levels of telomere length regulator Tel1p and TORC1 component Tor1p; reduction-of-function mutations confer rapamycin sensitivity and reduced telomere length

briefDescription: Subunit of the ASTRA complex, involved in chromatin remodeling
description: Subunit of the ASTRA complex, involved in chromatin remodeling; telomere length regulator involved in the stability or biogenesis of PIKKs such as TORC1; involved in the cellular stress response; similar to S. pombe Tti2p; may interact with Rsm23p; GFP-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm
functionSummary: Predicted subunit of the ASTRA complex; involved in the stress response; localizes to the cytoplasm in a large-scale study

briefDescription: Subunit of the ASTRA complex, involved in chromatin remodeling
description: Subunit of the ASTRA complex, involved in chromatin remodeling; telomere length regulator involved in the stability or biogenesis of PIKKs such as TORC1; similar to S. pombe Tti1p; detected in highly purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies
functionSummary: Subunit of the ASTRA complex with unknown function; localizes to the nucleus and mitochondrion in large-scale studies

briefDescription: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation
description: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the endosome; YLR408C is not an essential gene
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays altered competitive fitness on various media; null mutant displays abnormal accumulation of polyphosphate and has an abnormal colony appearance on sucrose plates; null mutant has increased resistance to both canavanine and thialysine, indicative of an altered endocytic flux of amino acid permeases; heterozygous diploid null mutant has decreased starvation resistance and is haploinsufficient

briefDescription: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation
description: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation; interacts with Msb3p; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to endosomes

briefDescription: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation
description: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation; interacts with Msb3p; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the endosome
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays decreased competitive fitness on minimal medium; null mutant has a decreased rate of galactose utilization; null mutant displays a strong vacuolar fragmentation defect; homozygous diploid null mutant has increased resistance to oxidative stress; heterozygous diploid null has decreased starvation resistance and is haploinsufficient

briefDescription: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation
description: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation; interacts with Msb3p; null mutant is sensitive to drug inducing secretion of vacuolar cargo; green fluorescent protein (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant is resistant to canavanine and thialysine; in systematic studies mutants show reduced competitive fitness and increased sensitivity to rapamycin

briefDescription: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation
description: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation; interacts with Vps21p-GFP; has potential role in vacuolar function, as suggested by its ability to bind Vac8p; likely member of; Vab2p-GFP-fusion localizes to cytoplasm in punctate pattern

briefDescription: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation
description: Subunit of the BLOC-1 complex involved in endosomal maturation; null mutant is sensitive to drug inducing secretion of vacuolar cargo; GFP-fusion protein localizes to the endosome
Subunit of the CBF3 complex; CBF3 binds to the CDE III element of centromeres, bending the DNA upon binding, and may be involved in sister chromatid cohesion during mitosis
functionSummary: Subunit of the CBF3 complex that binds to centromeric DNA and initiates kinetochore assembly; localized to the chromosomes
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional (ts) mutant shows elevated chromosome instability even at permissive temperature; overexpression in Sigma1278b diploid leads to increased invasive growth

briefDescription: Subunit of the CCR4-NOT1 core complex
description: Subunit of the CCR4-NOT1 core complex; this complex has multiple roles in the regulation of mRNA levels including regulation of transcription and destabilization of mRNA by deadenylation; basal transcription factor that increases initiation and elongation; activates the ATPase activity of Dhh1p, resulting in processing body disassembly

briefDescription: Subunit of the CCR4-NOT transcriptional regulatory complex
description: Subunit of the CCR4-NOT transcriptional regulatory complex; CCR4-NOT complex is evolutionarily-conserved and involved in controlling mRNA initiation, elongation, and degradation
functionSummary: Component of the CCR4-NOT complex that is involved in positive regulation of transcription elongation from RNA Polymerase II promoter
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays decreased competitive fitness in minimal medium, and an altered free amino acid profile; null mutant has elevated cell surface metal reductase activity; heterozygous null mutant is haploproficient; overexpression results in a decreased growth rate

briefDescription: Subunit of the CoA-Synthesizing Protein Complex (CoA-SPC)
description: Subunit of the CoA-Synthesizing Protein Complex (CoA-SPC); subunits of this complex are: Cab2p, Cab3p, Cab4p, Cab5p, Sis2p and Vhs3p; probable dephospho-CoA kinase (DPCK) that catalyzes the last step in coenzyme A biosynthesis; null mutant lethality is complemented by human homolog DCAKD and by E. coli coaE (encoding DPCK); detected in purified mitochondria in high-throughput studies; also localized to lipid droplets
functionSummary: Predicted dephospho-CoA kinase involved in coenzyme A biosynthetic process; component of the CoA-synthesizing complex
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional mutants accumulate decreased amounts of 18S rRNA at elevated temperatures; reduced function mutants show increased competitive fitness; repression causes sensitivity to the TDP-43 human RNA-binding protein that forms inclusions and aggregates in ALS disease models; overexpression slows growth, induces chromosome instability; heterozygous diploid nulls are haploinsufficient

briefDescription: Subunit of the CoA-Synthesizing Protein Complex (CoA-SPC)
description: Subunit of the CoA-Synthesizing Protein Complex (CoA-SPC); subunits of this complex are: Cab2p, Cab3p, Cab4p, Cab5p, Sis2p and Vhs3p; probable pantetheine-phosphate adenylyltransferase (PPAT); PPAT catalyzes the fourth step in the biosynthesis of coenzyme A from pantothenate; null mutant lethality is complemented by E. coli coaD (encoding PPAT) and by human COASY
functionSummary: Pantetheine-phosphate adenylyltransferase subunit of the CoA-synthesizing complex that is involved in coenzyme A biosynthetic process
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional mutant is heat sensitive

description: Subunit of the cohesin complex; which is required for sister chromatid cohesion during mitosis and meiosis and interacts with centromeres and chromosome arms; relocalizes to the cytosol in response to hypoxia; essential for viability
functionSummary: A chromatin binding protein that is part of the nuclear mitotic cohesin complex; involved in sister chromatid cohesion; localizes to the nucleus

description: Subunit of the COMPASS (Set1C) complex; COMPASS methylates histone H3 on lysine 4 and is required in transcriptional silencing near telomeres

Subunit of the COMPASS (Set1C) complex; COMPASS methylates histone H3 on lysine 4 and is required in transcriptional silencing near telomeres; WD40 beta propeller superfamily member with similarity to mammalian Rbbp7
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays defects in chromosome maintenance and dynamics, increased accumulation of glycogen and increased flocculation

description: Subunit of the COMPASS (Set1C) complex; COMPASS methylates lysine 4 of histone H3 and is required in chromatin silencing at telomeres; contains a Dpy-30 domain that mediates interaction with Bre2p; similar to C. elegans and human DPY-30

briefDescription: Subunit of the COMPASS (Set1C) histone H3K4 methyltransferase complex
description: Subunit of the COMPASS (Set1C) histone H3K4 methyltransferase complex; required for Set1C stability and optimal activity; COMPASS methylates histone H3 on lys 4 and is involved in telomeric silencing; subunit of CPF (cleavage and polyadenylation factor), a complex involved in RNAP II transcription termination

Subunit of the condensin complex; condensin reorganizes chromosomes during both mitosis and meiosis; essential SMC chromosomal ATPase family member that forms a subcomplex with Smc2p that has ATP-hydrolyzing and DNA-binding activity, but other condensin subunits are required for chromatin binding; required for clustering of tRNA genes at the nucleolus
functionSummary: Subunit of the nuclear condensin complex that binds double-stranded DNA, chromatin, and has ATPase activity; involved in chromosome condensation and separation as well as synaptonemal complex assembly

description: Subunit of the condensin complex; condensin reorganizes chromosomes during both mitosis and meiosis; forms a subcomplex with Smc2p that has ATP-hydrolyzing and DNA-binding activity, but other condensin subunits are required for chromatin binding; required for tRNA gene clustering at the nucleolus; potential Cdc28p substrate
functionSummary: Subunit of the nuclear condensin complex that binds chromatin and has ATPase activity; involved in chromosome condensation and meiotic chromosome separation, synaptonemal complex assembly; unwinds DNA during DNA replication

description: Subunit of the condensin complex; required for chromosome condensation and for clustering of tRNA genes at the nucleolus; may influence multiple aspects of chromosome transmission
functionSummary: Chromatin-binding subunit of nuclear condensin complex; involved in tRNA gene clustering, mitotic chromosome condensation, and mitotic sister chromatid segregation
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional mutant undergoes a predominantly heterogenous first cycle arrest with abnormal anaphase spindle morphology, and stretched chromosomes with decreased coordinated movement of pericentromeres; conditional mutant accumulates > 2C DNA content; conditional mutant has chromosome condensation defects, decreased tRNA-mediated silencing and abnormal localization of tRNA to the nuclear periphery rather than the nucleolus; overexpression results in decreased vegetative growth, accumulation of medium to large budded cells with up to 4C DNA content; heterozygous null mutant is haploinsufficient

description: Subunit of the condensin complex; required for establishment and maintenance of chromosome condensation, chromosome segregation and chromatin binding by the complex; required for tRNA genes clustering at the nucleolus; required for replication slow zone breakage following Mec1p inactivation; transcription is cell cycle regulated, peaking in mitosis and declining in G1; protein is constitutively degraded by the proteasome; rate limiting for condensin recruitment to chromatin
functionSummary: Chromatin-binding subunit of nuclear condensin complex; involved in mitotic chromosome condensation, mitotic sister chromatid segregation, tRNA gene clustering, rDNA condensation, meiotic chromosome condensation, meiotic chromosome separation, and negative regulation of meiotic DNA double-strand break formation

description: Subunit of the condensin complex; required for establishment and maintenance of chromosome condensation, chromosome segregation, chromatin binding of condensin, tRNA gene clustering at the nucleolus, and silencing at the mating type locus; required for replication slow zone (RSZ) breakage following Mec1p inactivation

briefDescription: Subunit of the conserved chromosomal passenger complex (CPC)
description: Subunit of the conserved chromosomal passenger complex (CPC); complex regulates kinetochore-microtubule attachments, activation of the spindle tension checkpoint, and mitotic spindle disassembly; other complex members are Ipl1p, Bir1p, and Nbl1p

briefDescription: Subunit of the conserved chromosomal passenger complex (CPC)
description: Subunit of the conserved chromosomal passenger complex (CPC); complex regulates mitotic chromosome segregation; not required for the kinase activity of the complex; mediates the interaction of Sli15p and Bir1p; other complex members are Ipl1p, Sli15p, and Bir1p
Subunit of the Cop9 signalosome; Cop9 signalosome is required for deneddylation, or removal of the ubiquitin-like protein Rub1p from Cdc53p (cullin); involved in adaptation to pheromone signaling
functionSummary: Subunit of the Cop9 signalosome that is required for deneddylation of cullin (Cdc53p); involved in regulation of pheromone response signaling pathway; localized to the nucleus
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant exhibits increased neddylation of cullin (Cdc53p); enhanced shmoo formation and mating efficiency; in competitive growth studies, mutants show reduced fitness

description: Subunit of the Cop9 signalosome; which is required for deneddylation, or removal of the ubiquitin-like protein Rub1p from Cdc53p (cullin); involved in adaptation to pheromone signaling; functional equivalent of canonical Csn6 subunit of the COP9 signalosome
functionSummary: Subunit of COP9 signalosome, the protein deneddylation complex, which removes ubiquitin-like protein Rub1p, similar to mammalian NEDD8, from proteins; functions in adaptation of pheromone response signaling pathway; localized to the nucleus
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant displays elevated neddylation of cullin (Cdc53p) and exhibits lower frequency of shmoo formation and reduced mating efficiency; in competitive growth experiments null mutant shows decreased fitness

briefDescription: Subunit of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) complex
description: Subunit of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) complex; this complex cleaves the ubiquitin-like protein Nedd8 from SCF ubiquitin ligases; plays a role in the mating pheromone response

briefDescription: Subunit of the core form of RNA polymerase transcription factor TFIIH
description: Subunit of the core form of RNA polymerase transcription factor TFIIH; has both protein kinase and DNA-dependent ATPase/helicase activities; essential for transcription and nucleotide excision repair; interacts with Tfb4p

briefDescription: Subunit of the CSN and 26S proteasome lid complexes
description: Subunit of the CSN and 26S proteasome lid complexes; similar to mammalian p55 subunit and to another S. cerevisiae regulatory subunit, Rpn7p; Rpn5p is an essential protein; the COP9 signalosome is also known as the CSN
functionSummary: Peripheral lid subunit of proteasome regulatory particle involved in protein deneddylation
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional (ts) mutations cause increased sensitivity to bleomycin and hydroxyurea, increased chromosome instability; heterozygous null mutant diploid shows increased sensitivity to toxins

briefDescription: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex
description: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex; related to Tcp1p, essential protein that is required for the assembly of actin and tubulins in vivo; contains an ATP-binding motif
functionSummary: Subunit of the chaperonin-containing T-complex (TriC) that mediates protein folding
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional mutation causes hypersensitivity to benomyl; repression leads to abnormal mitochondrial morphology; haploinsufficient, has chromosome instability in heterozygous diploid; overexpression results in slow growth; overexpression in Sigma1278b causes increased invasive growth

briefDescription: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex
description: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex; related to Tcp1p, required for the assembly of actin and tubulins in vivo
functionSummary: Subunit of the chaperonin-containing T-complex (TriC) that mediates protein folding
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene in systematic studies; haploinsufficient, showing slow growth and chromosome instability in heterozygous diploids; overexpression leads to slow growth rate

briefDescription: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex
description: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex; related to Tcp1p, required for the assembly of actin and tubulins in vivo
functionSummary: Subunit of the chaperonin-containing T-complex (TriC) that mediates protein folding
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; conditional (ts) mutants show increased sensitivity to benomyl and abnormal mitochondrial morphology; haploinsufficient, resulting in chromosome instability in heterozygous diploids

briefDescription: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex
description: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex; related to Tcp1p, required for the assembly of actin and tubulins in vivo
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; reduction of function causes decreased competitive fitness

briefDescription: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex
description: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex; related to Tcp1p, required for the assembly of actin and tubulins in vivo; capable of binding Q/N rich proteins and mediating their folding
functionSummary: Subunit of the chaperonin-containing T-complex (TriC) that mediates protein folding
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene; reduction of function leads to decreased competitive fitness and hypersensitivity to benomyl; overexpression causes slow growth

briefDescription: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex
description: Subunit of the cytosolic chaperonin Cct ring complex; related to Tcp1p, required for the assembly of actin and tubulins in vivo; mutant has increased aneuploidy tolerance
functionSummary: Subunit of the chaperonin-containing T-complex (TriC) that mediates protein folding
phenotypeSummary: Essential gene in systematic studies; haploinsufficient, showing chromosome instability and lowered innate thermotolerance in heterozygous diploids; overexpression leads to slow growth rate; overexpression in Sigma1278b results in greatly decreased filamentous and invasive growth

briefDescription: Subunit of the cytosolic iron-sulfur (FeS) protein assembly machinery
description: Subunit of the cytosolic iron-sulfur (FeS) protein assembly machinery; required for maturation of cytosolic and nuclear FeS proteins and for normal resistance to oxidative stress; deficiency results in shortened lifespan and sensitivity to paraquat; homologous to human Narf

briefDescription: Subunit of the Dcp1p-Dcp2p decapping enzyme complex
description: Subunit of the Dcp1p-Dcp2p decapping enzyme complex; decapping complex removes the 5' cap structure from mRNAs prior to their degradation; enhances the activity of catalytic subunit Dcp2p; regulated by DEAD box protein Dhh1p; forms cytoplasmic foci upon DNA replication stress
functionSummary: Subunit of the decapping (DCP1-DCP2) complex, acts as an activator for the catalytic subunit Dcp2p that cleaves off the 5' cap from mRNA enabling mRNA turnover; localizes to the cytoplasmic P-bodies
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation causes slow growth and heat sensitivity; scored as essential in strain S288C in a systematic study, likely due to slow growth

briefDescription: Subunit of the DSC ubiquitin ligase complex
description: Subunit of the DSC ubiquitin ligase complex; golgi-localized RING-finger ubiquitin ligase (E3) involved in sorting polar transmembrane domain containing membrane proteins to multivesicular bodies for delivery to the vacuole; proposed involvement in the quality control of misfolded TMD containing proteins; ortholog of fission yeast dsc1
functionSummary: Ubiquitin protein ligase subunit of the Dsc E3 ubiquitin ligase complex; involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolism via the multivesicular body pathway; localizes to Golgi apparatus and vacuole

briefDescription: Subunit of the DSC ubiquitin ligase complex
description: Subunit of the DSC ubiquitin ligase complex; protein of unknown function that localizes to the ER and vacuole lumen; overexpression affects endocytic protein trafficking; ortholog of fission yeast dsc3
functionSummary: Subunit of the Dsc E3 ubiquitin ligase complex whose biological role is unknown; localizes to teh endoplasmic reticulum and vacuole lumen
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; overexpression causes abnormal vacuolar morphology and reduced growth rate; in systematic studies mutants in strain Sigma1278b show decreased biofilm formation and lowered levels of some mRNAs

description: Subunit of the EGO/GSE complex; the vacuolar/endosomal membrane associated EGO/GSE complex regulates exit from rapamycin-induced growth arrest, stimulating microautophagy and sorting of Gap1p from the endosome to the plasma membrane; essential for the integrity and function of EGO; gene exhibits synthetic genetic interaction with MSS4
functionSummary: A subunit of the EGO complex involved in signal transduction and microautophagy; localizes to the vacuole membrane and late endosome membrane

description: Subunit of the EGO/GSE complex; the vacuolar/endosomal membrane associated EGO/GSE complex regulates exit from rapamycin-induced growth arrest, stimulating microautophagy and sorting of Gap1p from the endosome to the plasma membrane; identified by homology to Ashbya gossypii; EGO2 has a paralog, EGO4, that arose from the whole genome duplication
functionSummary: Subunit of the EGO complex involved in TORC1 signaling and Slm4p localization to the vacuole; localizes to vacuolar membrane

description: Subunit of the EGO/GSE complex; the vacuolar/endosomal membrane associated EGO/GSE complex regulates exit from rapamycin-induced growth arrest, stimulating microautophagy and sorting of Gap1p from the endosome to the plasma membrane; loss results in a defect in vacuolar acidification
functionSummary: Subunit of the EGO complex involved in microautophagy and vacuolar acidification; localizes to late endosome membrane

description: Subunit of the EGO/GSE complex; the vacuolar/endosomal membrane associated EGO/GSE complex regulates exit from rapamycin-induced growth arrest, stimulating microautophagy and sorting of Gap1p from the endosome to the plasma membrane; required for ribosomal small subunit export from nucleus; required for growth at low temperature

briefDescription: Subunit of the endosomal Vps27p-Hse1p complex
description: Subunit of the endosomal Vps27p-Hse1p complex; complex is required for sorting of ubiquitinated membrane proteins into intralumenal vesicles prior to vacuolar degradation, as well as for recycling of Golgi proteins and formation of lumenal membranes

briefDescription: Subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3)
description: Subunit of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF3); component of unknown function; deletion causes defects in mitochondrial organization but not in growth or translation initiation; can rescue cytokinesis and mitochondrial organization defects of the Dictyostelium cluA- mutant; eIF3 is also involved in programmed stop codon readthrough
functionSummary: Cytoplasmic RNA-binding protein of unknown biological role; localizes to stress granules
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutation causes abnormal mitochondrial morphology but has no effect on respiratory competence

description: Subunit of the exocyst complex; the exocyst mediates polarized targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles to active sites of exocytosis prior to SNARE-mediated fusion; PtdIns[4,5]P2-binding protein that localizes to exocytic sites in an actin-independent manner, targeting and anchoring the exocyst with Sec3p; involved in exocyst assembly; direct downstream effector of Rho3p and Cdc42p; relocalizes from bud neck to cytoplasm upon DNA replication stress
functionSummary: Subunit of the exocyst complex which mediates the targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles containing exocytic cargo to sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane; interacts directly with the active, GTP-bound form of several Rho GTPases and is involved in Rho protein signal transduction; binds PtdIns[4,5]P2; involved in exocyst assembly; localizes to sites of polarized growth

description: Subunit of the exocyst complex; the exocyst mediates polarized targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles to sites of exocytosis prior to SNARE-mediated fusion; PtdIns[4,5]P2-binding protein that localizes to exocytic sites in a Rho1p-dependent, actin-independent manner, targeting and anchoring the exocyst to the plasma membrane with Exo70p; direct GTP Rho1p effector; required for ER inheritance; relocalizes away from bud neck upon DNA replication stress
functionSummary: Subunit of the exocyst complex which mediates the targeting and tethering of post-Golgi secretory vesicles containing exocytic cargo to sites of exocytosis at the plasma membrane; interacts directly with the active, GTP-bound form of Cdc42 (Rho GTPase), and with PtdIns[4,5]P2; involved in exocyst assembly and ER inheritance; localizes to sites of polarized growth

description: Subunit of the GET complex; involved in insertion of proteins into the ER membrane; required for the retrieval of HDEL proteins from the Golgi to the ER in an ERD2 dependent fashion and for meiotic nuclear division
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows defects in protein retention in ER and is sensitive to elevated temperatures, shows abnormal mitochondrial morphology, defective respiratory growth, sensitivity to antifungal drugs, cell wall-affecting drugs, oxidative stress; homozygous diploid is unable to sporulate

description: Subunit of the GET complex; involved in insertion of proteins into the ER membrane; required for the retrieval of HDEL proteins from the Golgi to the ER in an ERD2 dependent fashion and for normal mitochondrial morphology and inheritance
functionSummary: Anchoring protein involved in retrograde vesicle-mediated Golgi to endoplasmic reticulum (ER) transport and protein insertion to ER membrane; localizes with Golgi to ER Traffic (GET) complex and putatively integral to membrane
phenotypeSummary: Non-essential gene; null mutant shows defects in protein retention in ER and is sensitive to elevated temperatures, shows abnormal mitochondrial morphology and defective respiratory growth, also shows sensitivity to antifungal drugs, cell wall-affecting drugs and oxidative stress

briefDescription: Subunit of the GINS complex (Sld5p, Psf1p, Psf2p, Psf3p)
description: Subunit of the GINS complex (Sld5p, Psf1p, Psf2p, Psf3p); complex is localized to DNA replication origins and implicated in assembly of the DNA replication machinery
